ingredients: 3.5 cup low sodium vegetable broth, 1.5 cup quinoa, 6.0 tablespoon i can't believe it's not butter it's vegan, 2.0 zucchini, 2.0 cup cherry tomatoes, 1.0 shallots, 1.0 clove garlic, 2.0 tablespoon fresh basil leaves
steps: bring 3 cups broth to a boil in medium saucepan over medium high heat . stir in quinoa and 2 tbsp . i can't believe it's not butter it's vegan and return to a boil . reduce heat and cook, covered, until water is absorbed, about 15 minutes . remove from heat and fluff with fork set aside . meanwhile, melt remaining 4 tbsp . spread in large nonstick skillet over medium high heat and cook squash, tomatoes, shallot and garlic, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned and tender, about 10 minutes . spoon quinoa onto serving platter, then top with vegetables . add remaining 1/2 cup broth to same skillet and and bring to a boil over medium high heat . cook until reduced by half, about 2 minutes . pour over vegetables and quinoa . sprinkle with basil.

name: pressure cooker cherry cola pulled pork
description: pressure cooker cherry cola pulled pork with cola beverage, onion, salt, pork butt, smucker's natural tart cherry fruit spread, barbecue sauce, pepper, kaiser rolls
ingredients: 12.0 ounce cola beverage, 1.0 onion, 1.5 teaspoon salt, 3.5 pound pork butt, 0.8 cup smucker's natural tart cherry fruit spread, 0.8 cup barbecue sauce, 0.5 teaspoon pepper, 12.0 kaiser rolls
steps: combine cola, onion and salt in multi use programmable electric pressure cooker . stir . add pork, turning to coat . place lid on pressure cooker twist and lock according to manufacturer's instructions . place exhaust valve in the sealing position . press manual button and set time for 45 minutes . when cooking is complete, turn off . allow pressure to release naturally, about 20 minutes . remove lid according to manufacturer's instructions . remove pork from pot . shred pork using two forks . reserve 1/2 cup meat juices discard remaining liquid . combine fruit spread, barbecue sauce and pepper in pressure cooker . stir until blended . press saute button . bring sauce to a simmer, stirring occasionally, about 3 minutes . stir in shredded pork . if necessary, add reserved meat juices, a little at a time, until desired consistency . sauce will thicken during standing . add additional meat juices, as necessary . serve on rolls.

name: greek pasta salad
description: i got tired of buying the prepackaged store version that barely feeds the family, never mind any guests that might show up for summer bbq's
ingredients: 2.0 container cherry tomatoes, 2.0 cucumbers, 2.0 green peppers, 1.0 package noodles, 1.0 bottle salad dressing, 1.0 onion, feta
steps: boil pasta as directed before the water boils you can cut up the vegetables into bite size pieces, except the tomatoes obviously . when pasta is cooked and cooled add the remaining ingredients and dressing toss, serve, and enjoy

name: autumn salad with pears and gorgonzola
description: sweet autumn pears, honey dijon dressing, crunchy pecans, and gorgonzola cheese . i love a good salad with lots of texture and flavors, this salad is a healthy addition to your fall table . simple and elegant, apples can be substituted for pears if you wish.
ingredients: 2 tbsp red wine vinegar, 1/2 tsp dijon mustard, 1 tsp honey, 1/4 tsp salt, fresh ground pepper, 3 tbsp olive oil, 2 small ripe pears, 1/4 cup 2 oz gorgonzola cheese, crumbled, 8 oz mixed baby greens, 1 oz about 20 halves pecans
steps: in a large bowl, mix vinegar, mustard, honey, salt and pepper . whisk in olive oil and blend . in a salad bowl combine baby greens, pears, gorgonzola cheese and pecans . when you are ready to serve, add the vinaigrette and toss well . serve immediately.

name: beef stir fry
description: "this quick version of stir fry tastes great and is easy to make . you'll love the flavor this dish has it's just as good as any take out you can find."
ingredients: 1.0 beef bouillon cube, 0.3 cup boiling water, 5.0 tablespoon low sodium soy sauce, 2.0 tablespoon cornstarch, 1.0 tablespoon teriyaki sauce, 2.0 teaspoon white sugar, 1.0 pound round steak, 1.0 tablespoon olive oil, 16.0 ounce frozen stir fry vegetables, 4.0 ounce water chestnuts
steps: dissolve beef bouillon cube in boiling water in a large bowl . stir soy sauce, cornstarch, teriyaki sauce, and sugar into the water . lay beef strips into the soy sauce mixture stir to coat beef entirely . heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat . cook and stir vegetables in hot oil briefly, about 1 minute . stir water chestnuts into the vegetable mixture, place a cover over the skillet, and cook at a simmer until the vegetables are hot, about 5 minutes . remove vegetable mixture with a slotted spoon to a large bowl, reserving juices in the skillet . pour beef with soy sauce marinade into the hot skillet cook and stir until browned completely, about 5 minutes . return vegetable mixture to the skillet bring to a simmer . cook and stir until completely hot, about 2 minutes.

name: kale, pear and cranberry salad
description: massaged kale salad with olive oil, lemon juice, pears, dried cranberries, and pine nuts . kosher, pareve, vegetarian, healthy, superfood.
ingredients: 1/3 cup raw pine nuts or unsalted raw sunflower seeds, 10 oz kale, 3 tbsp olive oil, 3 tbsp fresh squeezed lemon juice, 1 red bartlett pear diced into 1/2 inch cubes, 1/3 cup dried sweetened cranberries, 1/4 tsp salt, or more to taste
steps: toast the pine nuts or seeds in a small skillet over medium heat, stirring frequently, till golden brown . watch them carefully, they can easily go from brown to burned if you're not careful . as soon as they're toasted, remove them from the hot skillet to keep them from browning further.if your dried cranberries are super dry and not very soft, you can soak them in hot water for 5 minutes to plump and revive them . drain the cranberries and pat dry before assembling the salad . cut the thick stalk ends off of the kale, then chop the kale leaves into bite sized pieces . you should end up with around 8 10 cups of kale leaves . place the kale leaves into a salad bowl and pour the olive oil over them . massage the olive oil into the kale with clean fingers for 2 3 minutes till the kale is softened and slightly wilted . this will help remove bitterness from the kale . add the lemon juice, diced pear, cranberries, and toasted pine nuts to the bowl and sprinkle the salt evenly across the top . toss the salad till well mixed . let the salad sit for at least 5 minutes at room temperature . toss again, then serve . refrigerate leftovers in a sealed tupperware dish for up to 2 days.

name: saffron lamb chops with raita
description: saffron lamb chops with raita with onion, cilantro, plain whole milk yogurt, coriander, fresh lemon juice, cucumber, loin lamb chops, saffron threads, garlic, salt, freshly ground black pepper, olive oil
ingredients: 0.2 cup onion, 0.2 cup cilantro, 1.0 cup plain whole milk yogurt, 1.0 teaspoon coriander, 1.5 teaspoon fresh lemon juice, 0.8 cup cucumber, 8.0 loin lamb chops, 0.5 teaspoon saffron threads, 1.0 clove garlic, 0.5 teaspoon salt, 0.5 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 2.0 teaspoon olive oil
steps: place all raita ingredients in blender . pulse on setting 2 chop 10 12 times until finely chopped but not pureed . store in refrigerator until ready to use . combine saffron, garlic, salt and pepper in small bowl . rub into lamb chops and let sit at room temperature 15 minutes . heat 1 teaspoon olive oil in skillet over medium high heat . working in batches, sear lamb chops 2 3 minutes per side for medium rare . transfer to plate and cover while cooking remaining lamb chops . serve immediately with raita.

name: lemon parmesan roasted broccoli
description: this lemon and parmesan roasted broccoli is as addictive as french fries the recipe is a yummly original created by sara mellas https //www.yummly.com/dish/author/sara 20mellas .
ingredients: 1.0 bag broccoli florets, 2.0 tablespoon olive oil, 0.5 teaspoon salt, 0.1 teaspoon black pepper, 0.2 teaspoon garlic powder, 1.0 lemon, 3.0 tablespoon grated parmesan cheese
steps: preheat the oven to 400degf . line a large baking sheet with parchment paper . make sure the broccoli florets are roughly 1 inch wide, and arrange in an even layer on the baking sheet . drizzle the broccoli with olive oil . sprinkle with salt, black pepper, and garlic powder . use a rubber spatula to toss the broccoli until it is evenly coated in the oil . cut the lemon in quarters and squeeze the juice over the broccoli florets . arrange the slices on the pan among the broccoli . roast on middle rack of oven for 15 minutes . open the oven and sprinkle the parmesan cheese over the broccoli . toss lightly with a rubber spatula . continue roasting until cheese is lightly golden and the broccoli is crisp tender, 8 10 minutes . check to see that broccoli is done . remove from oven or add time as needed . discard the lemon wedges, and serve immediately.

name: boerenkool stamppot met rode paprika
description: smeuige boerenkool stamppot met rode paprika en boerenscharrel rookworst . een makkelijk en snel te bereiden gerecht
ingredients: 1250.0 gram ui, 1.0 ui, 2.0 clove knoflook, 2.0 paprika, 600.0 gram boerenkool, 2.0 tablespoon vloeibare margarine, 1.0 ree, 5.0 teaspoon suiker, 25.0 deciliter melk, 1.0 rookworst
steps: schil de aardappelen en snijd ze in stukken . pel en snipper de ui . pel de knoflook . maak de paprika's schoon en snijd ze in stukjes . kook de aardappelen in een laagje water met zout naar smaak, met de deksel op de pan in 10 minuten . verdeel na 10 minuten koken de boerenkool over de aardappelen en kook alles in 15 minuten gaar . verhit intussen de margarine in een ruime koekenpan en fruit de ui 3 minuten . pers de knoflook erboven uit en voeg de paprika toe . bak ze 5 minuten op een halfhoog vuur mee . voeg de tomatenpuree toe en bak deze 1 minuut mee . schenk 4 1/2 dl heet water in de pan en voeg de suiker toe . laat de tomatensaus in 10 minuten op een laag vuur inkoken tot een dikke saus en laat de paprika beetgaar worden . breng op smaak met peper en zout . verwarm de unox boerenscharrel rookworst volgens de aanwijzingen op de verpakking . giet de aardappelen en de boerenkool af en stamp ze door elkaar . voeg zoveel van de melk toe zodat de boerenkool smeuig genoeg is . verdeel de boerenkool stamppot over de borden en verdeel de paprika erover . snijd de boerenscharrel rookworst in vieren en leg de stukken bij de stamppot . eet smakelijk

name: bananas fosters topped overnight french toast
description: dessert for breakfast this make ahead baked french toast casserole topped with bananas fosters will wow your guests this easter put out some bowls of fresh berries and fruit and your guests wont even know this is a lightened up french toast.
ingredients: cooking spray, 10 oz challah bread, 2 large eggs, 1 cup egg substitute, 1 1/2 cups fat free milk, 1 1/2 tsp vanilla extract, 1/2 tsp cinnamon, 1/4 cup agave or white sugar, 1/4 tsp salt, 1 tsp meyers rum or rum extract, 1 tbsp light butter, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1 tbsp meyers rum or 1 tsp rum extract, 4 medium ripe bananas
steps: spray a 13 x 9 inch baking dish with cooking spray . arrange bread slices in one layer in baking dish, squeezing them slightly to fit . in a large bowl whisk together eggs, egg substitute, milk, vanilla, 1/2 tsp cinnamon, agave or sugar, salt and rum until combined well and pour evenly over bread . cover and refrigerate at least 8 hours or overnight for best results . preheat oven to 350deg f . and bring bread to room temperature . bake uncovered, in middle of oven until puffed and edges are pale golden, 40 to 45 minutes . meanwhile while it's baking, in a large deep saute pan melt light butter over low heat . add brown sugar, cinnamon, vanilla and rum and stir until sugar is dissolved . add a few drops of water if needed and let sauce simmer about 2 minutes . add sliced bananas and remove from heat . keep covered until french toast comes out of the oven . when french toast is cooked, divide among 8 plates and top with bananas . enjoy

name: bacon topped petite turkey meatloaf with bbq sauce
description: these easy bacon topped petite turkey meatloaf with bbq sauce are so moist with the addition of grated zucchini to the meatloaf mix
ingredients: 3/4 cup grated zucchini, 2 tbsp onion, 2 tbsp diced red pepper, 1/2 cup seasoned breadcrumbs, 1/4 cup kansas city bbq sauce, 1 large egg, 1 tsp smoked paprika, 1 tsp kosher salt, 1.3 lb raw 93 lean ground turkey, 5 slices center cut bacon, 2 1/2 tbsp kansas city bbq sauce
steps: preheat the oven to 350deg . lightly spray the petite loaf pan with cooking spray . in a large bowl, mix the zucchini, onion, red pepper, breadcrumbs, bbq sauce, egg, paprika and salt . add the turkey and combine until mixed through . create 5 equal loafs and place them into the loaf pan . place the 2 bacon halves over each loaf and top each with 1/2 tbsp additional bbq sauce . bake about 25 minutes or until cooked through.

name: grilled flank steak with black beans corn and tomatoes
description: this steak dish has a fiesta of flavors, the flank steak is seasoned with cumin and garlic and grilled to perfection, then topped with a fresh black bean, corn and tomato salad for a quick and tasty family friendly weeknight meal.
ingredients: 1 1/2 lb flank steak, 1/2 tsp cumin, 2 garlic cloves, 1/2 tsp kosher salt, fresh cracked pepper to taste, 3 tbsp red onion, 1 tsp olive oil, 1/4 cup fresh squeezed lime juice, 2 medium vine ripe tomatoes, 1 cup canned black beans, 1 cups frozen corn kernels, 2 tbsp finely minced cilantro, kosher salt and fresh pepper to taste
steps: season steak with the crushed garlic, cumin, salt and pepper and set aside 5 10 minutes . combine red onions, olive oil, lime juice, salt and pepper in a medium bowl and set aside a few minutes . add tomatoes, black beans, corn, cilantro and set aside . heat a clean lightly greased indoor or outdoor grill on high heat . grill steak on high heat, 6 8 minutes on each side or until your desired degree of doneness . let the meat rest about 5 minutes before slicing . slice the beef into thin slices across the grain, place on a platter and top with corn, black bean and tomato salad.

name: pasta met kip, groene groenten en mozzarella in tomatensaus
description: verrukkelijke pasta met kip, groene groenten en mozzarella in tomatensaus . dit pastagerecht uit italie is extra lekker door bertolli pasta penne rigate en bertolli pastasaus kruidig . dit pastagerecht is eenvoudig en zeer snel zelf te maken in slechts 20 minuten tijd.
ingredients: 400.0 gram kipfilet, 200.0 gram sperziebonen, 1.0 mozzarella, 350.0 gram penne, 200.0 gram broccoliroosjes, 2.0 tablespoon gin, 1.0 bag bertolli pastasaus kruidig
steps: snijd de kipfilet in stukjes en snij de puntjes van de sperziebonen . scheur de mozzarella in stukjes . kook de bertolli pasta penne rigate volgens de aanwijzingen op de verpakking 'al dente'. doe de broccoliroosjes en de sperziebonen 4 minuten voor het einde van de kooktijd bij de pasta in de pan . giet de pasta en de groenten af . verwarm ondertussen de extra vergine olijfolie in een koekenpan en bak hierin de kipblokjes met wat zout en peper rondom bruin en gaar . roer de bertolli pastasaus kruidig erdoor en laat het mengsel 5 minuten zachtjes pruttelen . schep nu de pasta met de groenten er goed doorheen en laat het gerecht nog een paar minuten doorwarmen . schep de pasta op borden en garneer met de stukjes mozzarella.

name: roast chicken and creamy garlic pasta
description: roast chicken and creamy garlic pasta with knorr pasta sides chicken, garlic powder, green peas, cream cheese, rotisserie chicken
ingredients: 1.0 package knorr pasta sides chicken, 0.2 teaspoon garlic powder, 1.0 cup green peas, 3.0 ounce cream cheese, 2.0 cup rotisserie chicken
steps: prepare knorr pasta sides chicken flavor according to package directions adding garlic powder to water . add peas to saucepan after 3 minutes . stir in cream cheese and chicken during last 2 minutes of cook time . cook, stirring occasionally, until cheese is melted and chicken is heated through, about 2 minutes.

name: chicken and white bean stuffed peppers
description: none
ingredients: 2 tsp olive oil, 1 onion, 4 cloves garlic, 1/2 half red bell pepper, 1/4 cup parsley, 5 bell peppers, 14 oz shredded cooked chicken breast, 1/2 tsp cumin, adobo, 15.5 oz can white beans, 1/2 cup reduced fat shredded cheddar
steps: in a medium pan, heat oil on medium heat . add the chopped onions, garlic, parsley and red pepper, saute until soft, about a minute . add the chicken and season with cumin and adobo . add beans and 1 to 1 1/2 cups of water and simmer for about 5 10 minutes, until it thickens and the liquid reduces . preheat oven to 350f . cut the peppers in half removing seeds and stem . place peppers in an oven proof dish . fill each pepper with 1/3 cup of chicken and bean mixture . pour about 1/3 cup water or chicken broth in the bottom of the baking dish . cover tight with foil . bake 30 minutes, until the peppers are soft . remove foil, top with cheese and bake uncovered another 5 minutes.

name: keftes de espinaca spinach keftes
description: how to make middle eastern keftes de espinaca spinach keftes . delicious vegetarian fried patties with spinach, mashed potatoes, egg, and breadcrumbs.
ingredients: 1/2 cup 1 tbsp olive or grapeseed oil, 1 onion, minced, 1/2 tsp crushed garlic, 10 oz fresh spinach leaves, rinsed and dried, 1 large egg, 1 cup mashed russet potatoes, 1/2 cup plain breadcrumbs or matzo meal for passover use matzo meal, 1 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp pepper, pinch cayenne optional, adds heat
steps: in a large skillet, warm 1 tbsp of olive or grapeseed oil over medium heat . saute minced onion for 5 minutes until translucent . add crushed garlic, saute for two minutes longer . add half of the fresh spinach and over the skillet, allow the spinach to wilt and shrink slightly, then add remaining half and cover again till all the spinach has wilted . remove from heat and transfer cooked mixture to a mesh strainer . with a spatula, gently press mixture in the strainer to remove excess moisture . transfer mixture to a cutting board and roughly chop . place chopped mixture into a mixing bowl . add remaining ingredients and mix thouroughly . with an ice cream scoop or 1/4 cup measuring cup, scoop the mixture into your hand and form smooth flat patties . place them onto a sheet tray as you go . heat remaining 1/2 cup of oil over medium heat . it should be at about 365 degrees f . place patties into the hot oil in small batches . fry until brown, about 4 min on each side . place on a paper towel or rack to drain . serve immediately.

name: golden crusted fish fillets with warm corn and tomato salsa
description: golden crusted fish fillets with warm corn and tomato salsa with all purpose flour, salt, large eggs, corn flakes or bran flakes cereal, crushed, fish fillets, country crock spread, onion, garlic, frozen whole kernel corn, knorr chicken flavor bouillon cube, tomato, chopped fresh cilantro, hot pepper sauce
ingredients: 0.5 cup all purpose flour, 1.0 teaspoon salt, 2.0 large eggs, 5.0 cup corn flakes or bran flakes cereal, crushed, 6.0 fish fillets, 12.0 tablespoon country crock spread, 1.0 onion, 4.0 clove garlic, 2.0 cup frozen whole kernel corn, 1.0 knorr chicken flavor bouillon cube, 2.0 tomato, 0.5 cup chopped fresh cilantro, 2.0 teaspoon hot pepper sauce
steps: in shallow dish, combine flour with 1/2 teaspoon salt . in medium bowl, egg combine mixture with remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt . in another bowl, place crushed corn flakes . dip fillets in flour, then egg mixture, then crushed corn flakes set aside . in 12 inch nonstick skillet, melt 4 tablespoons country crock spread over medium high heat and cook onion, stirring occasionally, 4 minutes . stir in garlic and cook 30 seconds . stir in corn and cook, stirring occasionally, 2 minutes . stir in prepared chicken broth and tomatoes . simmer uncovered, stirring occasionally, 5 minutes . stir in cilantro and hot sauce . remove salsa to serving platter and set aside . in another 12 inch skillet, melt 4 tablespoons spread over medium high heat and cook three fillets 5 minutes or until golden brown and fish flakes, turning once . remove to baking sheet and keep warm . wipe skillet clean repeat with remaining 4 tablespoons spread and fillets . to serve, arrange fillets over warm salsa . garnish, if desired, with additional chopped cilantro.

name: grilled pork tenderloins with corn on the cob
description: myrecipes.com
ingredients: 0.2 cup light brown sugar, 2.0 tablespoon kosher salt, 2.0 tablespoon paprika, 2.0 tablespoon dry mustard, 1.0 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1.0 teaspoon dried oregano, 1.0 teaspoon dried thyme, 4.0 pound pork tenderloins, 4.0 teaspoon olive oil, 6.0 ear fresh corn
steps: process first 7 ingredients in a food processor 30 seconds or until blended . remove silver skin from pork, leaving a thin layer of fat . pat tenderloins dry rub with oil, and coat with spice mixture . let pork stand at room temperature 30 minutes . pull back husks from corn remove and discard silks . tie husks together with kitchen string to form handles . rinse and dry exposed cobs . preheat grill to 350deg to 400deg medium high heat . grill pork, covered with grill lid, 10 to 12 minutes on each side or until a meat thermometer inserted in thickest portions registers 145deg . remove pork from grill, and let stand at room temperature 10 to 15 minutes . thinly slice one and one third tenderloins reserve remaining two and two thirds tenderloins for pork tenderloin wraps and pork, mango, and tomato salad . meanwhile, grill corn, covered with grill lid, 15 minutes or until golden brown, turning occasionally . sprinkle with desired amount of salt and pepper . reserve 2 ears corn for later use . serve remaining corn with grilled pork tenderloins.

name: sauteed chicken and vegetables over spaghetti squash
description: sauteed chicken and vegetables over spaghetti squash with spaghetti squash, promise buttery spread, grated parmesan cheese, zucchini, garlic, cherry tomatoes, fresh basil leaves, boneless, skinless chicken breast halves, water
ingredients: 1.0 spaghetti squash, 2.0 tablespoon promise buttery spread, 1.0 tablespoon grated parmesan cheese, 1.0 zucchini, 1.0 clove garlic, 1.0 cup cherry tomatoes, 1.0 tablespoon fresh basil leaves, 0.5 pound boneless, skinless chicken breast halves, 0.2 cup water
steps: arrange uncovered squash cut side down in 11 x 7 inch baking dish add water . microwave uncovered at high 10 minutes or until tender . let stand 5 minutes . gently scrape squash with fork to pull apart spaghetti like strands discard shallots . toss squash, 1 tablespoon promise buttery spread and cheese in medium bowl . meanwhile, melt remaining 1 tablespoon spread in 12 inch skillet and cook chicken, stirring occasionally, 6 minutes or until chicken is thoroughly cooked . remove chicken and keep warm . evenly divide squash between 2 dinner plates, then top with chicken mixture . season, if desired, with freshly ground black pepper . add zucchini to same skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, 5 minutes or until tender . stir in tomatoes and garlic and cook 2 minutes or until tomatoes are starting to break down . stir in basil . return chicken to skillet.

name: ham and cheese sandwich
description: ham and cheese sandwich with hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise, whole grain bread, cooked ham, provolone cheese, lettuce, tomato
ingredients: 1.0 tablespoon hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise, 2.0 slice whole grain bread, 4.0 ounce cooked ham, 2.0 ounce provolone cheese, 2.0 lettuce, 2.0 tomato
steps: evenly spread hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise on bread, then layer lettuce, ham, cheese, tomato and remaining bread.

name: mrs . monty's rolls
description: southern lvigin
ingredients: 0.2 ounce active dry yeast, 2.0 cup warm water, 0.5 cup sugar, 3.0 tablespoon shortening, 1.0 teaspoon table salt, 1.0 large egg, 6.5 cup all purpose flour, 3.0 tablespoon butter, 2.0 tablespoon butter
steps: combine yeast and water in a large bowl let stand 5 minutes . stir in sugar and next 3 ingredients . whisk in 3 cups sifted flour, 1 cup at a time, until combined . gradually stir in more flour to make a soft dough about 3 to 3 1/2 cups . using floured hands, shape dough into a smooth ball . place dough in a well greased bowl, turning to grease top . cover with plastic wrap . let rise in a warm place 2 hours or until doubled in bulk . punch dough down . roll dough out to 1/4 inch thickness on a floured surface . cut dough into rounds with a 3 inch round cutter, rerolling scraps once . lightly press each round into a 4 inch oval . spread 1/4 tsp . softened butter on half of each oval . fold unbuttered half over to form a half moon shape place 2 inches apart on 2 lightly greased baking sheets . cover and let rise in a warm place 40 minutes or until doubled in bulk . preheat oven to 375deg . bake, in batches, 14 to 15 minutes or until golden brown . transfer to a wire rack brush with melted butter.

name: fab tuna noodle casserole
description: read up on http //bit.ly/1dthtxy
ingredients: 1.0 pound pasta, 1.0 tablespoon butter, 1.0 onion, 3.0 tablespoon flour, 1.8 cup chicken broth, 1.0 cup milk, 1.0 pound mushrooms, 1.0 cup frozen peas, 20.0 ounce tuna, 8.0 ounce sharp cheddar cheese, 2.0 tablespoon parmesan cheese, 4.0 tablespoon breadcrumbs, 1.0 tablespoon butter
steps: read up on http //bit.ly/1dthtxy

name: basic homemade egg pasta dough
description: this homemade pasta dough recipe, which makes 1 1/2 pounds, has a beautiful yellow hue from the eggs and is great for making both cut and shaped pasta . you'll notice there's a range for the amount of flour . you'll want to start with the lowest amount first things like humidity, the size of the eggs, and how you measure flour are all factors that can affect how much flour you need . when measuring the flour, be sure you fluff up the flour with a spoon and then gently spoon it into a dry measuring cup, leveling the top with a knife . make sure not to pack the flour or scoop it with the measuring cup . the recipe is a yummly original created by ashley strickland freeman https //www.yummly.com/dish/author/ashley strickland freeman .
ingredients: 3.2 cup all purpose flour, 5.0 large eggs
steps: place 3 1/4 cups flour in a mound on a clean work surface and make a large well in the center . carefully crack the eggs into the center of the well . using a fork, whisk together the eggs in the well . gradually mix the flour into the eggs, starting at the center of the well and moving outwards, and using the fork to create a batter consistency at first . add a little flour at a time, mixing well before adding more you may not need all the flour the dough should be slightly sticky . once all of the flour is incorporated, shape the dough into a ball and knead until small blisters form and the dough is smooth, elastic, and no longer sticky, about 10 minutes . as you knead, keep a light dusting of flour on the work surface if the dough starts to stick too much or, if it's too dry, add a few drops of warm water . cover the dough with a damp towel or plastic wrap and let rest at least 30 minutes before cutting or shaping . letting it rest allows the flour to absorb liquid from the eggs and for the strands of gluten to relax . the longer you let the dough rest, the easier it will be to roll out . note you can make the dough up to 2 days before using . cover tightly with plastic wrap, and refrigerate . let the dough come to room temperature before rolling out . to make fettuccine, on a lightly floured surface, cut the rested dough into 4 equal portions . as you work, keep unused dough pieces covered with a damp towel or plastic wrap . using a rolling pin, roll 1 piece of dough as thinly as possible but still thick enough to be lifted off the counter without breaking . the dough should be paper thin, but you shouldn't be able to see through it . lightly dust the top of the fettuccine dough sheet with flour . fold dough in half bringing the short ends together and dust the top with flour . repeat folding twice more, dusting with flour between each layer to create a stack . use a sharp knife to cut the dough into 1/4 inch wide strips . separate noodles into "nests" and let dry uncovered on a lightly floured surface or baking sheet until no longer sticky so they won't stick to each other during cooking, about 15 minutes . repeat the process with the remaining dough pieces . to make cavatelli, on a lightly floured surface, cut the rested dough into 8 equal portions . as you work, keep unused dough pieces covered with a damp towel or plastic wrap . roll a piece of dough with your fingers into a 1/4 inch thick rope, dampening your hands with water if needed to help with rolling . repeat to shape remaining dough portions into ropes . cut each cavatelli rope into 1 inch pieces, again keeping them covered when unused . working with 1 piece at a time, firmly press your index and middle fingers into the dough piece, flattening the dough as much as possible . while pressing down, move your two fingers towards your body, allowing the dough to flatten and curl up over your fingertips to create cavatelli short pieces of pasta that are shaped like mini hot dog buns . repeat with all of the dough pieces . dust the dough with flour and place on a lightly floured surface or baking sheet . let dry uncovered on a lightly floured surface or baking sheet until no longer sticky so they won't stick to each other during cooking, about 15 minutes . to make pasta ahead, toss the cut or shaped pasta in a little flour, seal in zip top freezer bags, and refrigerate up to 2 days or freeze up to 4 months . thaw frozen pasta in the refrigerator before cooking . to cook pasta, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil . add the pasta and cook until al dente, 1 to 3 minutes for fettuccine or 10 to 15 minutes for cavatelli be careful not to overcook, or pasta can get mushy . add the cooked pasta to your favorite pasta sauce along with a little saved pasta water to help the sauce absorb into the pasta.

name: roasted baby potatoes with rosemary
description: a quick, fabulous side dish made with teeny tiny mini potatoes and fresh garden herbs such as rosemary made on the stove or roasted on the grill . minimal effort with excellent results.
ingredients: 1 lb teeny tiny potatoes, 2 tsp oil, 1 tsp kosher salt, fresh cracked pepper, 2 tbsp fresh rosemary
steps: place potatoes in a skillet with oil, salt and pepper on low heat . cook with a tight lid on for about 20 25 minutes, shaking the pan occasionally to prevent the potatoes from burning . remove from heat and let them sit 5 minutes without removing the lid . toss with fresh herbs and serve hot.

name: roasted red pepper hummus
description: uses kitchenaid k150 blender https //www.kitchenaid.com/countertop appliances/blenders/blender products/p.k150 3 speed ice crushing blender.ksb1325pa.html .
ingredients: 0.3 cup extra virgin olive oil, 1.0 can chickpeas, 1.0 cup roasted red bell pepper, 3.0 tablespoon tahini, 3.0 tablespoon fresh lemon juice, 2.0 tablespoon sun dried tomatoes, 1.0 teaspoon minced garlic, 1.0 teaspoon sea salt, 1.0 pinch smoked paprika
steps: throw the ingredients into your kitchenaid blender in the order listed . secure the lid, remove the center lid cap, and insert the tamper . blend on high for 30 to 60 seconds using the tamper to guide the ingredients through the blades until smooth and creamy . you may need to stop the machine and scrape down the sides of the container so that you don't get bits of chickpea and other ingredients in the hummus when you scrape the mixture out of the container . serve with a drizzle of olive oil and enjoy with chips, crackers, veggie sticks, or slathered on sandwiches or wraps.

name: cheesy parmesan roasted asparagus
description: with only a few minutes of prep, you'll get a big pan of tender crisp asparagus seasoned simply and generously with black pepper . add the cheese just before serving so it keeps its texture . the recipe is a yummly original created by edwina clark https //www.yummly.com/dish/author/edwina clark .
ingredients: 1.2 pound asparagus, 1.0 tablespoon olive oil, 0.5 teaspoon salt, teaspoon black pepper, 2.0 tablespoon grated parmesan cheese
steps: preheat the oven to 400degf . line a large baking sheet with parchment paper . trim the rough ends from the asparagus spears, and arrange on the baking sheet . drizzle the asparagus with olive oil . sprinkle with salt and black pepper, to taste . roast on middle rack of oven until asparagus is crisp tender, 10 12 minutes . check to see that asparagus is done . remove from oven or add time as needed . sprinkle the parmesan over the asparagus . serve immediately.

name: marsalapeertjes met choco ijs
description: marsalapeertjes met choco ijs with handperen, vloeibare margarine, suiker, marsala wijn, hertog 3 chocolades, munt
ingredients: 2.0 handperen, 7.5 tablespoon vloeibare margarine, 2.0 tablespoon suiker, 2.0 deciliter marsala wijn, 4.0 hertog 3 chocolades, 2.0 sprig munt
steps: schil de peren, snijd ze in vieren en verwijder de klokhuizen . verwarm de vloeibare margarine in een koekenpan en bak de peren met de suiker ca . 3 minuten op laag vuur . voeg de marsala wijn toe en laat het mengsel ca . 10 minuten stoven . neem de peren uit de pan en verdeel ze over 4 borden . schep in de holte van het klokhuis een bolletje chocolade ijs op en garneer het met munt.

name: potato spinach casserole
description: my family loves this every time
ingredients: 6.0 medium potatoes, 2.0 vegetable bouillon cubes, 0.5 cup plain yogurt, 3.0 tablespoon margarine, 0.2 teaspoon paprika, 2.0 all purpose seasoning, 1.0 cup grated cheese, 1.0 finely chopped onion, 1.0 teaspoon minced garlic, 2.0 peppers, 10.0 ounce fresh spinach, 1.0 teaspoon curry, 2.0 eggs
steps: preheat oven to 425f peel and chop potatoes and place in a saucepan with bouillon cube . cook till tender . drain and mash potatoes . add yogurt, 2 tbsp margarine, paprika, all purpose seasoning, curry and mix well . add eggs with electric beater on low for 1 minute . fold in cheese . in non stick skillet, melt 1 tsp margarine and saute onion, garlic and seasoning peppers . add spinach and cook until tender . spread half of the potato mixture into buttered 2 quart baking dish . layer with spinach then potato . sprinkle with remaining cheese and paprika . bake uncovered for 15 minutes or until top is golden brown.

name: orecchiette met broccoli en vongole
description: 'orecchiette' betekent 'oortjes' en dat is precies waar de pasta je aan doet denken.
ingredients: 1.0 broccoli, 2.0 tomaten, 1.0 bunch peterselie, 2.0 sjalotten, 350.0 gram andere, 1.0 kilogram vongole, 1.0 deciliter witte wijn, 3.0 tablespoon bertolli originale extra vergine olijfolie, zout, peper
steps: verdeel de broccoli in roosjes en snijd de tomaat in stukjes . hak de peterselie en sjalotjes fijn . kook de pasta beetgaar volgens de aanwijzingen op de verpakking . kook de laatste 5 minuten de broccoli mee . zet de vongole een half uurtje in zout water weg, zodat de schelpdiertjes hun zand uitspuiten . spoel de vongole daarna goed schoon . breng ze, met het deksel op de pan, aan de kook met de witte wijn . als alle schelpjes open zijn, ze de vongole klaar . haal de vongole uit hun schelpen en zeef het kookvocht door een fijne zeef . verhit de olijfolie en roerbak hierin de sjalotten . schep er de afgegoten pasta en broccoli, tomaten en peterselie door en warm het gerecht nog eens 2 minuten goed door . schenk het gezeefde kookvocht erover maak het op smaak af met zout en versgemalen peper.

name: quinoa chickpea and avocado salad
description: quinoa chickpea and avocado salad with cucumbers, tomatoes, red onion, lime juice and cilantro a flavorful vegetarian salad loaded with protein, fiber and healthy fats.
ingredients: 1 cup quartered grape tomatoes, 15 oz can garbanzo beans, 1 cup cooked quinoa, 2 tbsp red onion, 2 tbsp cilantro, 1 1/2 limes, kosher salt and fresh pepper, 1 cup diced cucumber, 4 oz diced avocado
steps: combine all the ingredients except for avocado and cucumber, season with salt and pepper to taste . keep refrigerated until ready to serve . just before serving, add cucumber and avocado.

name: chorizo and sweet potato side dish
description: this rustic dish is tailor made for meat and potato lovers, only here the meat is stuffed into casings meaning it's a sausage and the potatoes are sweet potatoes, but it's still the same super satisfying combination . blood sausage may not be to your liking, in which case you can just double down on the other type of link, or use whatever sausage you like best pork, beef, lamb, or a combination.
ingredients: 3.0 sweet potatoes, sweet pepper, 1.0 sausage, 1.0 sausage, olive oil
steps: peel and wash the potatoes well . cut into thin slices less than 1 / 2cm . arrange them evenly on a tray that can go to the oven previously greased with oil . sprinkle with sweet pepper . cut the sausage into slices but not totally cutting the slices, i.e . do not take the cut until the end . prick the sausage and the flour sausage with a fork . place the sausage and flour sausage over the potatoes, because this way the potatoes will also bake this fat . let bake for about 30 minutes.

name: turkey shepherd's pie
description: turkey shepherd's pie with olive oil, carrots, chopped celery, onions, chopped garlic, white mushrooms, shady brook farm 93/7 lean ground turkey, tomato paste, worcestershire sauce, all purpose flour, chicken broth, salt, pepper, mashed potatoes
ingredients: 3.0 tablespoon olive oil, 1.0 cup carrots, 1.0 cup chopped celery, 1.0 cup onions, 1.0 teaspoon chopped garlic, 2.0 cup white mushrooms, 1.2 pound shady brook farm 93/7 lean ground turkey, 2.0 tablespoon tomato paste, 2.0 tablespoon worcestershire sauce, 1.0 tablespoon all purpose flour, 0.5 cup chicken broth, salt, pepper, 4.5 cup mashed potatoes
steps: heat oven to 350degf . in large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium high heat . add carrots, celery and onions cook about 5 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally . add garlic cook 1 minute . remove vegetables from skillet . in same skillet, heat remaining oil . add mushrooms cook about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until browned . remove from skillet . add turkey to skillet cook about 5 minutes or until no longer pink, stirring occasionally to break up turkey . return vegetables to skillet . stir in tomato paste, worcestershire sauce and flour . add broth bring to a boil reduce heat and simmer 1 minute . season with salt and pepper . spoon evenly into a 6 cup ovenproof dish . spread mashed potatoes evenly on top, covering filling completely . bake until filling is bubbly and topping begins to brown, about 30 minutes.

name: apple 'n maple breakfast bread pudding
description: apple 'n maple breakfast bread pudding with promise buttery spread, fat free cholesterol free egg substitute, 1 milk, pure maple syrup, vanilla extract, ground cinnamon, granny smith apple, whole grain bread, promise buttery spread
ingredients: 1.0 tablespoon promise buttery spread, 0.2 cup fat free cholesterol free egg substitute, 0.5 cup 1 milk, 2.0 tablespoon pure maple syrup, 0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract, 0.2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 2.0 granny smith apple, 2.0 slice whole grain bread, 1.0 teaspoon promise buttery spread
steps: preheat oven to 350deg . coat 1 quart casserole dish with 1 teaspoon promise buttery spread set aside . melt remaining 1 tablespoon spread in 10 inch nonstick skillet over medium high heat and cook apples, stirring occasionally, 5 minutes or until golden . meanwhile, whisk egg substitute with milk, maple syrup, vanilla and cinnamon set aside . toss cooked apples with bread in medium bowl . pour egg mixture over bread toss to coat . turn into prepared pan . bake covered 35 minutes . remove cover and bake an additional 5 minutes or until golden . sprinkle, if desired, with confectioners sugar.

name: roasted potato and avocado salad
description: roasted potato and avocado salad with all purpose potatoes, orange, hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise, avocado, chopped fresh cilantro, red onion
ingredients: 1.5 pound all purpose potatoes, 2.0 orange, 10.0 tablespoon hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise, 1.0 avocado, 2.0 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro, 1.0 red onion
steps: preheat oven to 450degf . in large bowl, toss potatoes, orange peppers, onion and 2 tablespoons hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise . on large baking sheet, evenly arrange potato mixture . roast, stirring occasionally, 35 minutes or until potatoes are tender cool slightly . in large bowl, gently toss potato mixture, avocado, cilantro and remaining mayonnaise 1/2 cup . season, if desired, with salt and ground black pepper . serve warm or at room temperature.

name: cheese latkes
description: learn the history of latkes, dating back to 13th century italy . includes recipe for italian style ricotta cheese latkes . kosher, dairy, hanukkah.
ingredients: 1 cup high quality whole milk ricotta cheese, 3/4 cup flour, 3 large eggs, 2 tbsp granulated white sugar, 1 tsp kosher salt, 1/2 tsp baking powder, nonstick cooking oil spray, for frying
steps: combine all ingredients except the nonstick oil in a food processor . process the mixture for about 45 seconds, pausing a couple of times to scrape the sides, until the mixture forms a thick batter . spray a skillet with nonstick cooking oil and heat over medium . use a spoon to scoop up the batter, then pour it onto the hot skillet in the size/shape of silver dollar pancakes . use 1 2 tablespoons of batter per pancake . spread it out into a thin circle after it hits the skillet . fry the latkes for 2 3 minutes on each side until they turn golden brown . test the first latke for doneness and make sure it's cooked all the way through if the latkes are browning faster than they're cooking, reduce skillet heat . expect some variation in the shape of the latkes, they won't form a perfect circle . serve immediately . these latkes can be eaten plain or topped with a drizzle of honey . other toppings include jam or preserves, sour cream, maple syrup, yogurt or agave nectar.

name: boston cream pie cupcakes gf, df, egg, soy, peanut/tree nut free, top 8 free, vegan
description: a moist yellow cake, filled with thick, vanilla cream and topped with rich, chocolate buttercream my riff on the classic boston cream pie . gluten, dairy, egg, soy, peanut, tree nut free, top 8 free and vegan . from allergy awesomeness
ingredients: 2.5 cup gluten free flour blend, 1.0 cup granulated sugar, 2.0 teaspoon baking powder, 1.0 teaspoon baking soda, 0.2 teaspoon sea salt, 1.8 cup vanilla rice milk, 0.5 cup oil, 2.0 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1.0 tablespoon apple cider vinegar, yellow food coloring, 1.0 package vanilla, 1.5 cup vanilla rice milk, 6.0 tablespoon soy, 2.7 cup powdered sugar, 0.5 cup cocoa powder, 0.3 cup vanilla rice milk, 0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract
steps: cake directions preheat your oven to 350 degrees . grease cupcake tins . whisk together the dry ingredients . add the wet ingredients just until a nice batter evolves . add in food coloring if so desired note that if you don't, this will still taste great, but be more white since we don't have the typical eggs to color it yellow . scoop into cupcake tins . bake 15 minutes or until the tops of the cakes bounce back when gently touched and the edges are lightly browned . depending on your oven you might need to bake longer note that i am at a very high sea level . allow to completely cool on a wire rack . filling directions pour pudding mix and rice milk into a small sauce pan . heat over medium heat until it boils . boil for one minute . allow to cool . it will thicken even more as it cools . frosting directions in a stand mixer, beat shortening and cocoa powder . be sure to scrape the bowl and don't allow the cocoa to stick to the bottom of the bowl, but rather get completely incorporated . add the milk and then powdered sugar by alternating until you've added the full amounts . add in the vanilla and mix until fluffy and blended . assembling once the cupcakes have cooled, take a sharp knife and cut out a cone shape and eat or set aside for some light snacking later you will not need that portion i know some people try to re top the cupcake, but i left it off for optimal filling size . take a baby spoon, or small spoon, and fill it with the cooled pudding until it reaches the top of the cupcake . using a baggie with a snipped corner, or a frosting bag with tip, frost the cupcakes with the chocolate buttercream . keep covered.

name: mushrooms with blue cheese
description: mushrooms with blue cheese with button mushrooms, fresh parsley, fresh marjoram, extra virgin olive oil, butter, salt, white pepper, blue cheese
ingredients: button mushrooms, fresh parsley, fresh marjoram, extra virgin olive oil, butter, salt, white pepper, blue cheese
steps: 1. wash and slice all the mushrooms . 2. heat some olive oil in the pan, add a tablespoon of butter . 3. add fresh sliced marjoram and let it fizz for a couple of seconds while it's green . 4. add the mushrooms and let them cook until they're brownish . add some salt and pepper . 5. turn off the heat . 6. add the crumbled blue cheese and stir well until incorporated . 7. add the sliced parsley.

name: milky way ice cream
description: melted milky way candy bars and sweetened condensed milk are part of what make this ice cream ridiculously delicious
ingredients: 12.0 milky way candy bars, 14.0 ounce sweetened condensed milk, 8.0 cup whole milk, 0.5 cup chocolate syrup
steps: chop candy bars into small chunks . in a large saucepan add the chopped candy bars and sweetened condensed milk . cook over low heat, stirring often until candy bars are candy bars are mostly melted there will still be a few small chunks remove from heat and let cool slightly . add the chocolate syrup and milk to the candy bar mixture . stir well . this takes a little bit of time to get the melted candy bars and milk incorporated completely, just keep stirring . i like to use a whisk once i get the milk partially stirred in . pour mixture into a 4 quart ice cream freezer . freeze according to manufacturer's directions.

name: tri colored tomato salad with balsamic chicken
description: tri colored tomato salad with balsamic chicken with arugula, wish bone balsamic vinaigrette dressing, boneless, skinless chicken breasts, yellow tomato, ground black pepper, red onion, pine nuts
ingredients: 8.0 cup arugula, 0.5 cup wish bone balsamic vinaigrette dressing, 1.2 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, 4.0 yellow tomato, 0.1 teaspoon ground black pepper, 0.2 cup red onion, 2.0 tablespoon pine nuts
steps: pour 2 tablespoons wish bone balsamic vinaigrette dressing over chicken in large resealable plastic bag turn to coat . close bag and marinate in refrigerator up to 3 hours . grill or broil chicken, turning once, 10 minutes or until chicken is thoroughly cooked thinly slice . arrange arugula on serving platter then top with tomatoes, chicken, onion and pine nuts . just before serving, drizzle with remaining dressing and sprinkle with black pepper.

name: yum yum yum
description: good
ingredients: none none, none none, none none, none none, none none
steps: push it down lightly then roll it

name: pizza garlic bread
description: garlic bread fully loaded with sauce, cheese, and your favorite pizza toppings.
ingredients: 1.0 loaf italian bread, 1.3 cup marinara sauce, 2.0 clove garlic, 1.5 cup shredded mozzarella cheese, 0.2 cup grated parmesan cheese, 1.0 teaspoon italian herb seasoning, 0.5 cup pepperoni slices
steps: preheat the oven to 375degf . line a baking sheet with aluminum foil . arrange the bread halves cut side up on the sheet . spoon the marinara sauce over the bread halves and spread it into an even layer . sprinkle evenly with the minced garlic, shredded cheese, parmesan, and italian herb seasoning . arrange the pepperoni slices over the cheese, if using . bake the garlic bread on middle rack of oven, rotating the pan halfway through cook time, until the cheese is melted and the bread is light golden brown at the edges, 15 20 minutes . check to see that bread is done . remove from oven or add time as needed . cut the bread into 3 to 4 inch slices and serve immediately.

name: pasta gerookte kip en oesterzwammen
description: pasta gerookte kip en oesterzwammen with macaroni, gerookte kipfilet, oesterzwammen, melk, knorr mix voor macaroni carbonara, peterselie, kaas
ingredients: 300.0 gram macaroni, 250.0 gram gerookte kipfilet, 200.0 gram oesterzwammen, 500.0 milliliter melk, 1.0 bag knorr mix voor macaroni carbonara, 2.0 tablespoon peterselie, 50.0 gram kaas
steps: kook de macaroni beetgaar zoals aangegeven op de verpakking . snijd de kipfilet in plakken en de oesterzwammen in grote stukken . giet de melk in een pan, voeg de inhoud van het zakje knorr mix, de gerookte kipfilet en oesterzwammen toe . breng de saus al roerend aan de kook . zet het vuur laag en laat alles 2 3 minuten zachtjes doorkoken . serveer de pasta met de saus . strooi er peterselie en geraspte kaas over.

name: spritzed 'n grilled chicken and veggies
description: spritzed 'n grilled chicken and veggies with boneless, skinless chicken breast halves, eggplant, red bell pepper, sliced, yellow squash, salad
ingredients: 1.5 pound boneless, skinless chicken breast halves, 1.0 eggplant, 3.0 red bell pepper, sliced, 2.0 yellow squash, 40.0 spray salad
steps: spritz chicken and vegetables with wish bone salad spritzers italian vinaigrette dressing . grill or broil chicken and vegetables, turning once, 15 minutes or until chicken is thoroughly cooked and vegetables are just tender slice chicken . arrange chicken and vegetables on serving platter, then spritz with additional dressing . sprinkle, if desired, with chopped fresh basil leaves.

name: homemade pastrami
description: learn to make delicious deli quality pastrami at home with this simple and tasty recipe, adapted from the artisan jewish deli at home cookbook.
ingredients: 3 quarts water, 1 cup morton's coarse kosher salt, 1/4 cup pink curing salt, 1 cup granulated sugar, 1/2 cup firmly packed light or dark brown sugar, 1/4 cup honey, 2 tbsp pickling spice, 1 tbsp whole coriander seeds, 1 tbsp whole yellow mustard seeds, 4 cloves garlic, 3 4 lbs beef brisket, 1/4 cup ground coriander, 2 tbsp freshly ground black pepper, 2 tbsp smoked paprika
steps: to make the brine, fill a medium to large stockpot with 3 quarts water . add the kosher and pink salts, granulated and brown sugars, honey, pickling spice, coriander and mustard seeds, and garlic . bring to a boil over high heat, stirring often to fully dissolve the salt and sugar in the water . immediately remove the pot from the heat once the brine boils.add 3 quarts ice cold water to a 2 gallon or larger food safe container that will fit in your refrigerator . pour the brine into the container and place the container, uncovered, in the refrigerator until completely cool . we divided the brine evenly between two separate containers so that it would fit in the refrigerator . trim the fat from the brisket until the fat layer is about 1/4 inch thick . if necessary, cut the brisket in half so that it will fit into your container s . submerge the brisket in the cooled brine.allow the brisket to brine in the refrigerator for 5 days, flipping it daily top to bottom and stirring the brine . make sure that if any of the brisket sides are touching one another you regularly turn them away from each other to expose all of the sides to the brine . to cook the brisket, pour 4 cups water into the bottom of a 12 by 15 inch roasting pan . set a rack inside the pan and place the brisket on the rack, fatty side down . to make the spice rub, mix together the coriander, pepper and paprika in a small bowl . evenly rub 1/4 cup of the mixture onto the top of the brisket . then flip the brisket and rub the remaining spice mixture onto the fatty side . allow the brisket to come to room temperature, about 2 hours . preheat the oven to 300 degrees with a rack low enough to fit the pan holding the brisket . tightly cover the brisket and pan with a double layer of aluminum foil . bake until the meat reaches an internal temperature of 200 degrees, about 1 hour per pound or 3 4 hours total . without trimming the fat, carve the pastrami into 1/4 inch thick slices, or cut as thin as possible without the meat falling apart . keep tightly wrapped in aluminum foil or plastic wrap in the fridge for up to 1 week or in the freezer for up to 6 months . safety note handle the pink curing salt with care and keep it out of reach of children . it is used in pastrami and other cured meats to kill bacteria, prevent botulism and add flavor . however it is extremely toxic if ingested directly in fact, it's colored pink to prevent people from mistaking it for regular salt . when used with care in recipes like this, it is very safe and necessary for proper flavor and food safety . that said, you should know the risks and keep the curing salt properly labeled and out of the reach of children.

name: smoky spicy molasses bbq chicken
description: while her native south carolina is known for mustard based barbecue, food writer amethyst ganaway especially loves sticky sweet and spicy chicken with a molasses and tomato sauce . and because she's not always game for firing up the grill, she figured out a way to make her favorite chicken in the oven, with barbecue sauce just the way she likes it . it's a meal with a lot less mess and work than the typical southern cookout, but all the flavor . the recipe is a yummly original created by amethyst ganaway https //www.yummly.com/dish/author/amethyst ganaway .
ingredients: 1.0 cup ketchup, 0.2 cup blackstrap molasses, 0.2 cup apple cider vinegar, 1.5 tablespoon honey, 2.0 teaspoon light brown sugar, 3.5 teaspoon kosher salt, 1.0 teaspoon black pepper, 0.5 teaspoon cayenne, 0.2 teaspoon paprika, 0.8 teaspoon garlic powder, 3.0 pound chicken, 1.0 tablespoon vegetable oil, 0.5 teaspoon onion powder, 0.5 teaspoon dry mustard
steps: preheat oven to 350deg . in a small saucepan, mix ketchup, molasses, vinegar, honey, brown sugar, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon pepper, the cayenne, paprika, and 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder . cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until flavors have melded together and sauce thickens, 15 20 minutes . remove sauce from heat and set aside . meanwhile, place chicken in a baking or roasting dish about 9x13 inches, and coat with oil . in a small bowl, combine remaining 1 tablespoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder with the onion powder and mustard . sprinkle all over chicken . arrange chicken skin side down and bake for 15 minutes . using a pastry brush or silicone brush, coat the top side of the chicken with a bit of the bbq sauce, using about one quarter of it, so that pieces are covered well . cook skin side down for an additional 15 minutes . flip chicken so the skin side is up, and coat each piece well with some bbq sauce . increase the oven to 400deg . every 5 8 minutes, coat chicken with more of the sauce to your desired thickness i do about 4 coats . increase oven temperature to 500deg or use your top broiler option . finish cooking chicken until the sauce is thick, the chicken has some char, and the meat reaches 165deg in the thickest part . cooking time should be about 1 hour total.

name: banh bao thit
description: banh bao thit with pork belly, dark soy sauce, sweet soy sauce, fish sauce, garlic, ginger, black peppercorns, bay leaves, jalapeno chiles, cilantro sprigs, cucumber, carrots, daikon, water, rice wine vinegar, granulated sugar, salt, mayonnaise, sriracha chili sauce, sweetened condensed milk
ingredients: 2.0 pound pork belly, 1.0 cup dark soy sauce, 0.5 cup sweet soy sauce, 1.0 cup fish sauce, 4.0 clove garlic, 1.0 inch ginger, 1.0 tablespoon black peppercorns, 3.0 bay leaves, jalapeno chiles, cilantro sprigs, cucumber, 1.0 cup carrots, 1.0 cup daikon, 3.0 cup water, 0.3 cup rice wine vinegar, 2.0 tablespoon granulated sugar, 2.0 tablespoon salt, 1.0 cup mayonnaise, 0.2 cup sriracha chili sauce, 1.0 tablespoon sweetened condensed milk
steps: 1. combine all indredients and seal in a zip top bag, removing as much air as possible . marinade pork for 24 hours . 2. for the pickled slaw in a mixing bowl, combine carrots and daikon . in a sauce pot, combine water, vinegar, sugar and salt . bring to a simmer whisk to dissolve salt and sugar . pour the hot marinade over the carrots and daikon, cool to room temperature and refrigerate . 3. preheat an oven to 300degf . place all contents of your pork marinade into a roasting pan that allows the pork to be covered while braising . place a piece of parchment paper over the pork and seal tightly with foil . 4. braise the pork belly for 2 1/2 hours until tender . allow to cool in the marinade . 5. slice the belly into 1/4 " thick slices, cut just wide enough to fit into your steamed buns . 6. for serving heat each slice of pork in a nonstick skillet . 7. for the sriracha mayonnaise stir all ingredients to combine.

name: breakfast casserole
description: from my family
ingredients: 1.0 can crescent rolls, 6.0 eggs, 1.0 teaspoon oregano, salt, 0.3 cup milk, 1.0 pound sausage, 0.5 pound mozzarella cheese, 0.5 pound sharp cheddar cheese
steps: spray 9 x 13 pan with pam . preheat oven to 350f . place crescent rolls in bottom of pan and press edges together mix egg, salt and pepper, oregano and milk together layer sausage on top of crescent rolls . pour egg mixture on top . sprinkle with cheeses . bake for 35 minutes

name: mexican casserole
description: mexican casserole with vegetable oil, lean ground beef, chopped onion, potato, tomato, black beans, chili powder, salt, garlic powder, enchilada sauce, corn tortillas, shredded cheddar cheese
ingredients: 1.0 tablespoon vegetable oil, 1.0 pound lean ground beef, 1.0 cup chopped onion, 1.0 potato, 1.0 tomato, 15.0 ounce black beans, 1.0 teaspoon chili powder, 1.0 teaspoon salt, 0.5 teaspoon garlic powder, 2.0 can enchilada sauce, 16.0 corn tortillas, 1.5 cup shredded cheddar cheese
steps: 1. heat oven to 375 degrees f . coat a 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray . 2. heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium high heat . add ground beef and onion . cook for 5 minutes, until lightly browned . add potato and tomato and cook, covered, about 5 to 7 minutes, or until potato softens . 3. add beans, chili powder, salt and garlic powder . mix until well combined and set aside . 4. spread 1/4 cup of the enchilada sauce on bottom of baking dish . tear up 8 of the tortillas and layer over sauce . spoon on meat and bean mixture . pour 1/2 cup enchilada sauce evenly over meat layer . 5. tear up remaining 8 tortillas and layer over sauce . pour remaining sauce over top and sprinkle with cheese . 6. bake at 375 degrees f for 25 minutes or until bubbly and cheese is melted.

name: cookies and ice cream cupcakes
description: cookies and ice cream cupcakes with breyers blasts oreo cookies and cream frozen dairy dessert, vanilla wafer cookies, crushed, strawberries
ingredients: 3.0 cup breyers blasts oreo cookies and cream frozen dairy dessert, 6.0 vanilla wafer cookies, crushed, 0.8 cup strawberries
steps: line 6 cup muffin pan with paper liners . place 1 oreo cookie into each liner . evenly scoop breyers blasts oreo cookies and cream frozen dairy dessert into each cup . garnish with fruit . freeze 2 hours or until ready to serve.

name: mexican picadillo
description: this mexican picadillo recipe is very forgiving, so go ahead and make tweaks to make it your own . season as you go for more flavor and to customize the dish to your tastes . like things a little spicier chorizo makes a great substitute for the ground beef . for a "cook once, eat twice" meal, save half of the picadillo for our roasted picadillo stuffed bell peppers https //www.yummly.com/recipe/roasted picadillo stuffed bell peppers 2673655 . your future self will thank you . the recipe is a yummly original created by marwin brown https //www.yummly.com/dish/author/marwin 20brown .
ingredients: 14.0 ounce fire roasted tomatoes, 0.5 poblano peppers, 4.0 garlic cloves, 1.0 bunch fresh cilantro, 1.0 onion, 1.0 teaspoon kosher salt, 0.2 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1.0 yellow onion, 4.0 garlic cloves, 1.0 tablespoon tomato paste, 2.0 bay leaves, 2.0 teaspoon ground cumin, 2.0 teaspoon dried oregano, kosher salt, black pepper, 0.5 cup dry white wine, 1.5 pound ground beef, 2.0 teaspoon chili powder, 2.0 yukon gold potatoes, 2.0 carrots
steps: prepare sofrito place roasted tomatoes, poblano pepper, the first portion of the garlic cloves, cilantro, and first onion in blender/food processor and pulse to a salsa like consistency . season to taste with salt and pepper . set aside . if using fresh tomatoes, rinse the tomatoes and cut out the stems, then roast them in a 400 degree f oven for 20 minutes . saute diced onion in oil over medium heat for a few minutes . add diced garlic and saute 30 seconds . add tomato paste, bay leaves, cumin, oregano, salt, and pepper and cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes . tomato paste should be a nice dark color . add wine and cook until reduced to 1/4 cup, about 5 minutes . add ground beef and season with chili powder, salt, pepper, and additional cumin to taste . cook over medium heat until the ground beef begins to lose its pinkness . add the potatoes and carrots and saute briefly . add the sofrito mix, combine well, and simmer, covered, over medium low heat for 20 25 minutes, or until the potatoes are cooked all the way through . taste for seasoning and adjust as you wish, adding more chili powder, cumin, and salt as necessary . garnish with fresh cilantro and grated cheese, if you wish . serve half the mixture immediately, and refrigerate the other half to make stuffed bell peppers for tomorrow's dinner.

name: grilled matzo brisket wraps
description: kathy strahs shares a unique kosher for passover grilled panini wrap, perfect for using up your leftover passover brisket and matzo.
ingredients: 4 sheets of matzo, 1 medium avocado, 1 tbsp freshly squeezed lemon juice, 1/4 tsp coarse salt, plus more for sprinkling on matzo, 1/8 tsp freshly ground black pepper, 1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil, 1/2 lb leftover cooked brisket, shredded, 1/2 cup leftover cooked onions
steps: spread out heavy duty paper towels on a clean counter top . turn on cool water from the kitchen faucet and, one at a time, run each matzo under the water, wetting each side . lay each wet matzo down on the paper towels, leaving about a 1/2 inch gap in between them . then, place a soaking wet don't wring it paper towel on top of each matzo . let the water absorb into the matzo until it's easily bendable, like a noodle, about 20 minutes . check it periodically if it's still not bending easily, wait a little while longer . once the matzo is at the bendable stage, remove the wet paper towels and let the matzo dry a bit for about 10 minutes . don't rush this i learned if the matzo is too wet it will break . when it's ready, the matzo will bend without breaking . in the meantime, while you're waiting for the matzo, prepare the avocado spread . in a small food processor or blender, mix the avocado, lemon juice, salt and pepper until it's a smooth and creamy spread . give it a taste and season it with more salt or lemon juice as needed . heat the panini press to medium high heat . for each wrap brush a little olive oil on one side of a prepared matzo . sprinkle it with salt, if desired . carefully flip the matzo over to the other side and top it with brisket, onions and a few dollops of avocado spread . fold in two opposite corners of the matzo to encase the fillings, leaving the ends open . transfer the wraps, two at a time, to the panini press . close the lid and grill them until they're warmed through and the matzo is lightly crisped, 3 to 5 minutes . you might opt to prepare more matzo, if this is your first time, in case a few break . alternatively, you can quickly slice and cook half an onion in a skillet with a few teaspoons of olive oil over medium heat . season the onions with salt and pepper before adding them to the wrap . no panini press you can always bake these wraps in an oven or toaster oven at 350degf until they're hot and crisped, 5 to 10 minutes.

name: kimchi pork bao buns with pulled pork and crispy onions
description: kimchi pork bao buns with pulled pork and crispy onions with pork shoulder, gochujang base, paprika, chili powder, granulated garlic, cumin, coriander, allspice, salt, sugar, gochujang base, kimchi, bao buns, watercress
ingredients: 10.0 pound pork shoulder, 1.0 cup gochujang base, 2.0 ounce paprika, 2.0 tablespoon chili powder, 1.0 tablespoon granulated garlic, 2.0 teaspoon cumin, 2.0 tablespoon coriander, 0.5 teaspoon allspice, 3.0 tablespoon salt, 1.0 tablespoon sugar, 0.5 cup gochujang base, 2.0 quart kimchi, 20.0 bao buns, watercress
steps: 1. mix together paprika, chili powder, garlic, cumin, coriander, allspice, salt, sugar and hot pepper paste to make dry rub . 2. rub pork shoulder with dry rub, then rub with gochujang . 3. roast in oven at 300degf for about 4 1/2 hours, until tender . 4. when cool enough to handle, pull pork, allow to rest . 5. combine the pulled pork with chopped kimchi, taste and reseason if necessary . 6. steam bao buns for 5 7 minutes until they are hot and pliable.

name: crispy garlic parmesan potatoes
description: crisp oven baked potato slices are revved up with a hearty amount of garlic and parmesan cheese.
ingredients: 2.0 pound russet potatoes, 1.0 teaspoon salt, 0.2 teaspoon black pepper, 0.5 teaspoon garlic powder, 2.0 tablespoon olive oil, 0.3 cup shredded parmesan cheese, minced fresh parsley
steps: preheat the oven to 425degf . line a sheet pan or two, if needed with parchment paper . place the potatoes in a large mixing bowl . sprinkle both sides with salt, pepper, and garlic powder . drizzle with olive oil and flip the slices so they are evenly coated . arrange the potatoes in a single layer on the sheet pan s . roast the potatoes on the middle rack of the oven until they are beginning to brown on the edges, 30 35 minutes . if using two sheet pans, roast on the top and bottom racks, then swap the sheets halfway through the cooking time . open the oven and sprinkle the slices evenly with parmesan cheese . continue roasting for 7 10 minutes, until the cheese is melted and golden brown . check to see that potatoes are done . remove from oven or add time as needed . sprinkle the potatoes with minced parsley, if desired, and serve immediately.

name: kipstukjes met spinazie en mais
description: de kip in stukjes met spinazie en mais koken is een eenvoudig recept . alle ingredienten zijn lekker snel klaar . dat geldt ook voor de aardappel puree.
ingredients: 250.0 gram kipfilet, 2.0 tablespoon vloeibare margarine, 450.0 gram spinazie, 1.0 packet aardappelpuree, 50.0 gram kaas, 1.0 pinch nootmuskaat, 1.0 maiskorrels
steps: snijd de kipfilets in blokjes . verhit vloeibare margarine in een pan en bak hierin de kipblokjes in 6 minuten bruin en krokant . ontdooi en verwarm intussen de spinazie volgens de aanwijzingen op de verpakking . breng de spinazie op smaak met zout, peper en nootmuskaat en meng de maiskorrels erdoor . verwarm de 2 zakjes uit het pak knorr mix voor aardappelpuree volgens de aanwijzingen op de verpakking . breng de puree op smaak met peper en zout en schep de geraspte kaas erdoor . spuit met behulp van een spuitzak een rand puree op de borden . schep de spinazie in het midden en schep de kipstukjes op de spinazie.

name: sweet potato and carrot "tots"
description: none
ingredients: olive oil spray, 1 large, 1 large, 1 large egg, 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons whole wheat panko breadcrumbs, 1/4 cup grated mozzarella cheese, 1 teaspoon kosher salt, freshly ground black pepper, 1 teaspoon onion powder, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon smoked paprika
steps: preheat oven to 375 degrees and lightly spray a sheet pan with olive oil . set aside . cut sweet potato and carrot into 3 or 4 large chunks . place them in a food processor fitted with a metal blade and process until finely chopped into rice size pieces . heat a large skillet over medium heat, spray the pan with oil and add the chopped vegetables . cook, stirring for 5 minutes, until softened . transfer to a large bowl with the egg, panko, mozzarella, onion powder, garlic powder, smoked paprika, salt and pepper and stir with a spatula to ensure it is evenly combined . with your hands, gently form sweet potato carrot mixture into small rectangular pieces, pressing and rolling them firmly together about 1 tablespoon each . evenly space them on prepared sheet pan, spray with olive oil and bake for 10 minutes . remove from oven, using your hands or small spatula, flip each over, put them back in the oven and bake for 10 12 more minutes, or until brown and crisp . makes 30 tots.

name: tomatensoep met geroosterde paprika en artisjokken
description: een zalige tomatensoep met geroosterde paprika en artisjokken . gemaakt met de bertolli pastasaus pittig voor een volle en kruidige soep.
ingredients: 1.0 bag bertolli pastasaus pittig, 1.0 liter kippenbouillon, 4.0 tomaten, 3.0 geroosterde paprika, 3.0 artisjokharten, 2.0 sprig basilicum, 50.0 gram kaas
steps: breng in een pan de bertolli pastasaus pittig aan de kook . voeg zout en peper naar smaak toe en laat de soep 10 minuten zachtjes koken . snijd de tomaten in vieren en haal de zaadjes en het sap eruit . snijd het overgebleven vruchtvlees in kleine stukjes en meng deze 2 minuten voor het einde van de kooktijd door de soep . snijd ondertussen de geroosterde paprika, de artisjokken en de basilicumblaadjes fijn en meng dit met elkaar . verdeel dit mengsel over de soepkommen en schenk de soep erbovenop . schaaf tot slot van de parmezaanse kaas wat mooie krullen en garneer hier de soep mee.

name: kip zoetzuur met wortel en paksoi
description: verrukkelijk rijstgerecht met zoetzure saus en kipfilet . de zoetzure saus is knorr chicken tonight zoetzuur met perzik . een zacht gekruide zoetzure saus waar je mee kan roerbakken, gevuld met stukjes perzik en rode en groene paprika . dit rijstgerecht voor 4 personen maak je eenvoudig en snel zelf in minder dan een half uur tijd.
ingredients: 350.0 gram rijst, 350.0 gram kipfilet, 1.0 paksoi, olijfolie, 250.0 gram wortel, 1.0 jar knorr chicken tonight zoetzuur met perzik, bladpeterselie
steps: kook de rijst volgens de aanwijzingen op de verpakking . snijd de kipfilet in blokjes . snijd de paksoi in repen . verwarm een flinke scheut olijfolie in een wok en bak hierin de kipfilet goudbruin . roerbak vervolgens de wortelbolletjes nog enkele minuten mee . schep de knorr chicken tonight zoetzuur met perzik en de paksoi erdoor en laat het 8 minuten zachtjes pruttelen . serveer met de rijst en garneer met de peterselie.

name: vietnamese spring rolls with slow cooked pork
description: recipe courtesy of jaden hair of steamykitchen.com
ingredients: 2.0 pound pork sirloin roast, 1.0 teaspoon coriander, 0.8 teaspoon kosher salt, 0.5 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 1.0 cup orange juice, 1.0 cup reduced sodium chicken broth, 2.0 tablespoon fish sauce, 6.0 clove garlic, 2.0 teaspoon ginger, 1.0 yellow onion, 1.0 orange, 7.0 ounce plum sauce, 1.5 teaspoon ginger, 1.0 tablespoon fish sauce, 8.0 ounce spring roll wrappers, 2.0 medium carrot, 0.5 english cucumber, 1.0 red bell pepper, 2.0 cup baby spinach, 0.1 cup mint leaves, 0.1 cup fresh basil
steps: orange coriander pork season pork roast with coriander, salt and pepper . add orange juice, broth, 2 tbs fish sauce, garlic and 2 tsp ginger to a 3 1/2 to 5 quart slow cooker . scatter half the onion and orange in the slow cooker, top with pork, then add remaining onion and orange . cover and cook on low until an instant read thermometer inserted in the center of the pork registers 160 degrees f, about 3 3/4 hours . transfer the pork to a carving board . rest for at least 15 minutes . sweet plum dipping sauce combine all sauce ingredients in a small bowl 3/4 cup sweet plum sauce, 1 1/2 tsp grated ginger, 1 tbs fish sauce . assembly slice pork across the grain into very thin slices . divide into 22 portions . half fill a wide bowl with warm water . for each roll, soak 1 wrapper until just pliable . shake off the excess water and place on a lint free kitchen towel . fold in half to make half moon shape . place 1 portion of pork at the bottom of the wrapper and top with carrot, cucumber, bell pepper, spinach mint leaves and basil . roll up the wrapper tightly . place roll on a platter and cover with a damp towel to keep moist . the rolls can be made and refrigerated up to 2 hours ahead . serve chilled with the sauce for dipping, a couple of spinach leaves and a few herbs.

name: one pot slow cooked chicken dinner one pot chef
description: one pot slow cooked chicken dinner is an easy to prepare slow cooker dinner that can be made all in the one pot chicken breasts and vegetables are added to the slow cooker, then smothered with a delicious herb marinade mix . the meat and veggies cook and marinate at the same time, producing a succulent, tender meal that the whole family will enjoy give it a go
ingredients: 2.0 pound chicken breast fillets, 1.0 pound small red potatoes, 0.5 pound baby carrots, 0.2 cup olive oil, 0.3 cup lemon juice, 1.0 teaspoon dried oregano, 1.0 teaspoon onion powder, 2.0 teaspoon crushed garlic, 1.0 teaspoon salt, cracked black pepper
steps: make the seasoned marinade mix into a measuring cup, add the olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, onion powder, crushed garlic, salt and pepper, and stir until well mixed, about 15 seconds . put the chicken breast fillets in the bottom of your crock pot/slow cooker . add the quartered potatoes on one side . add the carrots on the other side . pour the marinade over everything . cover and cook four hours on high or eight hours on low . enjoy your one pot slow cooked chicken dinner video is here https //www.youtube.com/watch v vvltnc zw k

name: spaghetti with mushrooms, garlic and oil
description: none
ingredients: 12 oz baby bella mushrooms, 3 cloves garlic, 2 tbsp olive oil, crushed red pepper flakes, 1/4 cup white wine, 1/2 lb 8 oz . ronzoni smart taste uncooked spaghetti, 2 tbsp parsley, salt and fresh pepper
steps: cook pasta in a large pot of salted boiling water according to package directions . meanwhile, heat oil in a medium saute pan over medium heat . add the garlic and red pepper flakes and cook until soft, about 1 minute . add the sliced mushrooms, salt and pepper and saute about 2 minutes . add white wine and cook another 3 minutes . before draining the pasta reserve 1/4 cup of the pasta water . drain pasta and toss with mushrooms, parsley and pepper . if pasta is too dry, add a little of the reserved pasta water . serve with grated cheese if you wish.

name: lasagne met tonijn, courgette en citroen
description: deze vis lasagne met tonijn, courgette en citroen is een rustige maar zalige lasagne met de echte italiaanse smaak door de bertolli pasta lasagne en traditioneel toscaanse pastasaus.
ingredients: 2.0 courgettes, 1.0 citroen, 2.0 can tonijn, 1.0 bag bertolli pastasaus traditioneel toscaans, 1.0 tablespoon bertolli vloeibaar voor koken, bakken en roerbakken, 400.0 gram lasagne, 4.0 tablespoon kaas
steps: verwarm de oven voor tot 200 degc . schaaf de courgettes met een dunschiller in dunne lange plakken . rasp de schil van de schoongeboende citroen . laat de tonijn uitlekken . meng de bertolli pastasaus traditioneel toscaans met 1 dl koud water, de geraspte citroenschil en de tonijn . vet een ovenschaal ca . 2 1/2 l inhoud in met wat bertolli vloeibaar en bedek de bodem met een dunne laag pastasaus en een laagje courgetteplakjes . bestrooi de courgette met wat peper en zout en bedek met een laagje bertolli pasta lasagne . herhaal tot alles op is en eindig met een laagje saus . bestrooi met de geraspte jonge kaas . laat de lasagne in de hete oven in ca . 30 min . gaar en goudbruin worden . schep de lasagne aan tafel op de borden.

name: brown coconut rice with cilantro
description: coconut milk, brown rice, coconut flakes, fresh ginger and cilantro are combined to create this simple side dish, perfect to accompany many thai dishes.
ingredients: 1 cup uncooked brown rice, 1 cup lite coconut milk, 1 1/4 cup water, 1 tsp grated fresh ginger, 1 garlic clove, 1/4 tsp salt, 2 tbsp sweetened grated coconut, 3 tbsp cilantro
steps: in a medium sized heavy pot, add coconut milk, rice, water, ginger, garlic, salt and coconut bring to a bowl over medium heat . reduce heat to low, cover and simmer until all liquid evaporates, about 40 45 minutes . remove from heat, keep covered for 10 more minutes . fluff with a fork toss with cilantro.

name: easy garlic herb baked salmon
description: there's no need to go out when you have this recipe for restaurant quality salmon prepared right at home in minutes the recipe is a yummly original created by sara mellas https //www.yummly.com/dish/author/sara 20mellas .
ingredients: 4.0 salmon fillets, 2.0 teaspoon unsalted butter, 0.5 teaspoon salt, black pepper, 3.0 clove garlic, 2.0 sprig fresh rosemary, 1.0 lemon
steps: preheat the oven to 400degf . line a baking sheet with parchment paper . gently pat salmon fillets dry with paper towels . place on the baking sheet, skin side down . use a butter knife or spoon to gently spread an equal amount of the softened butter over the top of each salmon fillet . sprinkle the top of the salmon with the salt and black pepper . finely mince the garlic . remove and discard the rosemary stems . finely mince the leaves . distribute the minced garlic and rosemary evenly over the tops of the salmon fillets . bake the salmon on middle rack of oven until it flakes easily with a fork, 12 15 minutes . check to see that salmon is done . remove from oven or add time as needed . squeeze fresh lemon juice over salmon if desired . serve immediately . refrigerate leftovers in an airtight container for up to 2 days.

name: whole orange sephardic charoset
description: cheryl sternman rule shares a unique kosher for passover charoset featuring the bitter sweetness of a whole orange, peel and all serve with matzo at your seder.
ingredients: 1 medium seedless orange, well rinsed, preferably organic, 1 lb medjool dates about 22 24, pits removed and discarded, 3 tbsp sugar, 1/2 tsp cinnamon, 2 tbsp sweet red wine, 1/2 cup pecans or walnuts, toasted, finely chopped
steps: cut the orange into 6 8 rough pieces do not peel and place in a food processor fitted with the metal blade . add the dates . process for about 15 seconds, or until a mushy paste forms but rough chunks of orange peel are still visible . place the paste in a small saucepan with the sugar, cinnamon, and wine . cook over low heat for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally . watch carefully so it doesn't burn . transfer to a serving bowl and stir in the chopped nuts.

name: zesty beef stir fry
description: zesty beef stir fry with flank steak, vegetable oil, vegetables, ginger root, minced garlic, au jus gravy, worcestershire sauce
