ingredients: 9.0 cup cereal, 6.0 ounce semi sweet chocolate chips, 0.5 cup skippy creamy peanut butter, 0.2 cup butter, 1.0 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1.5 cup powdered sugar
steps: 1. measure cereal into large bowl set aside . 2. microwave chocolate chips, skippy creamy peanut butter and butter in 1 quart microwavable bowl uncovered on high 1 minute stir . microwave 30 seconds longer or until mixture can be stirred smooth . stir in vanilla . pour chocolate mixture over cereal in bowl, stirring until evenly coated . pour into 2 gallon plastic food storage bag add powdered sugar . close bag shake until well coated . spread on waxed paper to cool . store in airtight container in refrigerator.

name: voorjaarspasta met kip, peultjes en lente uitjes
description: pasta met kip gebakken in bertolli vloeibare margarine, knapperige peultjes, lente uitjes en fijngehakte peterselie in een heerlijke traditioneel toscaanse tomaten pastasaus.
ingredients: 400.0 gram pasta, 200.0 gram peultjes, 1.0 bunch uitjes, 400.0 gram kipfilet, 2.0 tablespoon bertolli voor koken, bakken en roerbakken, 600.0 gram bertolli pastasaus traditioneel toscaans, 3.0 tablespoon gehakt
steps: kook de pasta volgens de aanwijzingen op de verpakking . giet de pasta af . was peultjes en verwijder de puntjes . snijd het wit en lichtgroene deel van de lente ui in schuine stukjes en het donkere groen fijn . snijd de kip in reepjes . verhit de vloeibare margarine in een ruime hapjespan of wok . bak de kip 5 min . op matig vuur . voeg de peultjes en de stukjes lente ui toe en bak 3 min . mee . voeg de pastasaus toe en breng het geheel aan de kook . schep de pasta om met de peterselie en peper naar smaak . verdeel de pasta over 4 warme diepe borden . schep de pastasaus met kip en peultjes erover en bestrooi het gerecht met het fijngesneden groen van de lente ui.

name: mixed baby greens with blackberries, pecans and champagne vinaigrette
description: none
ingredients: 1 large bunch mixed baby greens, 1 medium bunch arugula, 1 package blackberries, 30 pecan halves, 2 tbsp champagne vinegar, kosher salt and freshly ground pepper, 1 tsp basil, 6 tbsp extra virgin olive oil
steps: for the dressing, place vinegar in a non reactive mixing bowl with basil, salt and pepper to taste . drizzle the olive oil in a slow stream, whisking until the oil is emulsified . toss the washed mixed greens with the vinaigrette . sprinkle with blackberries and pecans and serve.

name: yiaourti me meli greek yogurt, honey and nuts
description: a simple greek dessert with greek yogurt, walnuts, cinnamon and honey . a no bake treat that is full of protein . vegetarian, gluten free.
ingredients: 1/2 cup greek yogurt, 1 tbsp crushed walnuts, cinnamon to taste, 1 tbsp honey, more or less to taste
steps: spoon the yogurt into a small dessert dish . sprinkle crushed walnuts over the top of the yogurt . you can toast the walnuts lightly in a hot skillet, if you'd like, to bring out more of their natural flavor . sprinkle the yogurt with cinnamon and drizzle with honey . serve.

name: healthy breaded shrimp
description: delicious and healthy baked breaded shrimp, without the added fat . jumbo shrimp, coated with seasoned breadcrumbs, panko and grated cheese, then baked until golden.
ingredients: 16 oz jumbo shrimp, salt and pepper to taste, 1/4 cup egg substitute, 6 tbsp whole wheat italian seasoned breadcrumbs, 2 tbsp panko, 2 tbsp grated parmesan cheese, cooking spray
steps: preheat oven to 450deg . spray a baking sheet with cooking spray . put the egg beaters in one bowl, and the breadcrumbs, panko and parmesan cheese in another . wash and dry the shrimp . season shrimp with salt and pepper, then put a few at a time in the bowl with the egg beaters to coat . put a few pieces of shrimp at a time into the breadcrumb mixture to coat, then on a baking sheet . once all the shrimp is breaded, if you still have crumbs left, re dip the shrimp back into the egg beaters and then back into crumbs and back onto the baking sheet . spray the top of the shrimp generously with baking spray then bake in the middle rack for about 6 7 minutes . turn shrimp over then cook another 3 minutes or until cooked though . remove from oven and serve right away with lemon wedges.

name: easy cheesy garlic bread
description: no need to visit a restaurant or pizza shop when you can make buttery, cheesy garlic bread right at home
ingredients: 1.0 loaf italian bread, 6.0 tablespoon salted butter, 1.5 teaspoon garlic powder, 1.5 cup shredded cheese, 0.2 cup grated parmesan cheese
steps: preheat the oven to 375degf . line a baking sheet with aluminum foil . place the bread halves cut side up on the sheet . spread the softened butter evenly over bread halves . sprinkle evenly with the garlic powder, shredded cheese, and parmesan . bake the garlic bread on middle rack of oven, rotating pan halfway through cook time, until cheese is melted and bread is light golden brown at edges, 15 20 minutes . check to see that garlic bread is done . remove from oven or add time as needed . cut the bread into 2 to 3 inch slices, and serve.

name: chocolate monster paw cookies
description: chocolate monster paw cookies with all purpose flour, baking powder, i can't believe it's not butter all purpose sticks, sugar, large eggs, vanilla extract, salt, unsweetened cocoa powder, semi sweet chocolate chips, chopped walnuts, cherries
ingredients: 2.2 cup all purpose flour, 0.2 teaspoon baking powder, 1.0 cup i can't believe it's not butter all purpose sticks, 1.3 cup sugar, 2.0 large eggs, 0.5 teaspoon vanilla extract, 0.2 teaspoon salt, 0.5 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1.0 cup semi sweet chocolate chips, 0.8 cup chopped walnuts, 0.5 cup cherries
steps: combine flour, cocoa, baking powder and salt in medium bowl set aside . preheat oven to 350deg . line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper set aside . beat i can't believe it's not butter all purpose sticks with sugar in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed just until combined . beat in eggs, one at a time, then vanilla until blended . beat in flour mixture on low just until combined . stir in remaining ingredients . drop dough onto prepared baking sheets 4 inches apart using large scoop or slightly rounded 1/3 cup measure . bake 13 minutes or until edges are just starting to set . do not overbake . cool on cookie sheets 2 minutes . remove cookies to wire racks and cool completely.

name: classic deviled eggs rachael ray
description: rachael ray magazine
ingredients: 12.0 hard boiled eggs, 0.5 cup mayonnaise, 3.0 scallions, 2.0 tablespoon flat leaf parsley, 2.0 tablespoon sweet pickle juice, 2.0 teaspoon dijon mustard, 0.5 teaspoon fresh dill, 0.5 teaspoon ground cumin, 0.2 teaspoon garlic powder, salt, sweet paprika
steps: in a medium bowl mash the egg yolks . stir in the mayonnaise, scallions, parsley, pickle juice, mustard, dill, cumin and garlic powder season with salt and pepper . spoon the mixture into the egg white halves . sprinkle each deviled egg with paprika.

name: italiaanse stracciatella flensjes met rozijntjes
description: dit recept flensjes met chocolade maken dit toetje typisch italiaans . het bevat ijs met chocola en rozijnen, maar ook poedersuiker . deze italiaanse stracciatella flensjes met rozijntjes is klaar in 10 minuten.
ingredients: 4.0 flensjes, 8.0 hertog romige stracciatella, poedersuiker, 4.0 rozijnen
steps: leg de warme flensjes op ontbijtbordjes . schep op elk flensje 2 bolletjes hertog romige stracciatella ijs . strooi er poedersuiker over en vouw de flensjes dubbel over het ijs . strooi er nog wat poedersuiker over en leg de doosjes met rozijntjes ernaast om er aan tafel zelf over te strooien.

name: sugar cookie tier
description: sugar cookies decorated with royal icing and arranged as a miniature tier cake.
ingredients: 370.0 gram plain flour, 0.5 teaspoon salt, 0.5 teaspoon baking powder, 240.0 gram unsalted butter, 110.0 gram caster sugar, 1.0 vanilla pod, 1.0 egg, 1.0 egg white, 0.5 teaspoon lemon juice, 300.0 gram icing sugar, 4.0 tablespoon water, sugar pearls
steps: for full directions visit your sunny side up http //www.yoursunnysideup.com/2013/07/giveaway sugar cookie tier recipe simply bridal jewelry giveaway/

name: pastitsio
description: pastitsio is a decadent and delicious dish . it is aromatic, flavorful, and hearty . it takes 85 minutes to prepare this dish so make sure you have time to prepare it . this hearty dish is perfect for a sunday dinner the whole family will love . make sure to include these ingredients in your next grocery shopping list so you can surprise your family with this decadent dish . why are you waiting
ingredients: olive oil, 1.0 onion, 2.0 garlic cloves, 650.0 gram ground lamb, 400.0 gram crushed tomatoes, 1.0 tablespoon fresh mint, 2.0 teaspoon sugar, 2.0 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 0.5 teaspoon ground nutmeg, 0.2 teaspoon ground cloves, salt, ground black pepper, 225.0 gram noodles, 2.0 eggs, 300.0 milliliter greek yogurt, 600.0 gram feta cheese crumbles, salt, ground black pepper, 40.0 gram parmesan cheese
steps: in a large stock pot, heat up a drizzle of olive oil . add the onion and saute until softened . then add the garlic and do the same . add the ground meat and stir until golden on all sides and well separated . add the tomatoes, mint, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and salt and pepper to taste . bring to a boil . lower the heat and simmer 20 minutes, stirring occasionally until the mixture starts to thicken . preheat the oven to 200 degrees celsius . boil the macaroni noodles according to package directions . drain and set aside . in a bowl, beat the eggs together with the greek yogurt and feta cheese . salt and pepper to taste but remember feta is usually pretty salty . grease a baking dish . pour the meat mixture into the baking dish . top with the drained macaroni . then finish with the greek yogurt mixture . sprinkle parmesan cheese on top and bake for 40 minutes or until the top is golden . this dish is best when left to refrigerate for 1 day and served at room temperature.

name: roasted broccoli and cauliflower
description: roasted broccoli and cauliflower is an easy, healthy, and delicious side dish . the recipe is a yummly original created by sara mellas https //www.yummly.com/dish/author/sara 20mellas .
ingredients: 0.5 pound broccoli florets, 0.5 pound cauliflower florets, 2.0 tablespoon olive oil, 0.5 teaspoon salt, 0.1 teaspoon black pepper, 0.2 teaspoon garlic powder
steps: preheat the oven to 400degf . line a large baking sheet with parchment paper . make sure the broccoli and cauliflower florets are roughly 1 inch wide, and arrange them in an even layer on the baking sheet . drizzle the florets with olive oil . sprinkle with salt, black pepper and garlic powder . use a rubber spatula to toss the broccoli and cauliflower until they are evenly coated in the oil . roast on middle rack of oven, stirring halfway through cook time, until broccoli and cauliflower are crisp tender and slightly charred, 22 25 minutes . check to see that broccoli and cauliflower are done . remove from oven or add time as needed . serve immediately.

name: easy mashed potatoes
description: if you thought you had to mash potatoes by hand to get a beautiful creamy texture, we have a surprise a mixer can do an excellent job . but don't hurry the process if you run the mixer too fast, the potatoes get overworked and won't be as fluffy . the addition of fresh chives adds a little surprise while keeping the mashed potatoes squarely in the classics camp . the recipe is a yummly original created by david bonom https //www.yummly.com/dish/author/david bonom .
ingredients: 4.0 pound russet potatoes, 1.2 cup milk, 6.0 tablespoon unsalted butter, 1.0 teaspoon salt, 0.2 teaspoon ground white pepper, 0.3 cup fresh chives
steps: peel potatoes and cut into 1 inch pieces . put potatoes in a dutch oven and add enough cold water to cover by 2 inches . bring to a boil over high heat . reduce heat to medium and simmer until tender, about 15 minutes drain . meanwhile, combine milk, butter, salt, and pepper in a small saucepan over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until milk is warm and butter melts, 2 minutes . combine potatoes and milk mixture in bowl of a stand mixer . beat on medium low speed with paddle attachment until potatoes are fluffy, 2 3 minutes . add chives and beat until incorporated, about 20 seconds longer . transfer potatoes to a bowl and serve.

name: all saints day doughnuts
description: make these delicious doughnuts for the next all saints day . fried and doughy, these all saints doughnuts are filled with a light rum flavored pastry cream and coated with powdered sugar . not particularly low in calories, these fluffy doughnuts are an exceptional treat that warrant a little splurging . ready in less than an hour, this recipe makes plenty of little doughnuts so you will have more than enough for yourself as well as some to share.
ingredients: 170.0 gram flour, 1.0 teaspoon baking powder, 250.0 gram water, 2.0 tablespoon butter, 1.0 teaspoon sugar, salt, 4.0 large eggs, vegetable oil, powdered sugar, 3.0 large eggs, 750.0 gram milk, 150.0 gram sugar, 50.0 gram rum, 60.0 gram flour
steps: in a bowl, sift the flour with the baking powder and set aside . in a pot, heat the water with butter, sugar, and salt until boiling . remove the pot from the flame and immediately pour in the flour/baking powder mixture all at once while whisking . place the pot back on the flame and continue stirring until a ball forms . remove from the flame again and let cool a bit . then, beat in the eggs one by one stirring well after each . set aside to cool even more . in a deep skillet, heat the oil on medium heat . with 2 teaspoons, measure out portions of the dough about the size of a nut . do not make them large as they will puff to about 4 times their original size when frying . transfer the dough into the oil . it will puff and turn itself over as it fries . when it is golden on all sides, remove from the oil to drain and cool on paper towels . separately, make the filling . make a double boiler making sure the top pot never touches the water of the bottom pot . in the top top pot, add in the eggs, milk, sugar, rum, and flour . constantly stir everything together until it starts to thicken into pastry cream . pour the liquid into a container, cover with plastic wrap directly touching the surface of the cream, and let cool . when the filling is room temperature, fill a pastry bag with it and attach a fine tip . pierce the doughnuts with the tip and fill with the pastry cream . sprinkle powdered sugar on top and serve.

name: old bay spiced shrimp cocktail
description: old bay spiced shrimp cocktail with cider vinegar, water, old bay seasoning, large shrimp, cocktail sauce
ingredients: 0.5 cup cider vinegar, 0.5 cup water, 2.0 tablespoon old bay seasoning, 1.0 pound large shrimp, 1.0 cup cocktail sauce
steps: mix vinegar, water and old bay seasoning in medium saucepan . bring to boil on medium heat . gently stir in shrimp cover . steam 2 to 3 minutes or just until shrimp turn pink . drain well . serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve . serve with cocktail sauce.

name: glazed pear and orange arugula salad
description: glazed pear and orange arugula salad with smucker's simply fruit orange marmalade spreadable fruit, white balsamic vinegar, crisco pure canola oil, salt, pepper, butter, bosc pears, firmly packed brown sugar, arugula, crumbled blue cheese, chopped pecans
ingredients: 0.2 cup smucker's simply fruit orange marmalade spreadable fruit, 4.0 teaspoon white balsamic vinegar, 3.0 tablespoon crisco pure canola oil, salt, pepper, 1.0 tablespoon butter, 2.0 bosc pears, 1.0 tablespoon firmly packed brown sugar, 2.0 cup arugula, 0.2 cup crumbled blue cheese, 0.2 cup chopped pecans
steps: whisk together spreadable fruit, vinegar and oil in small bowl . season with salt and pepper . melt butter in medium skillet over medium high heat . add pear slices . cook 1 to 2 minutes or until pears are sizzling . stir in brown sugar . cook 1 to 2 minutes more, turning once, until evenly glazed . remove from heat . divide arugula among 4 salad plates . top each with pear slices and blue cheese . drizzle with vinaigrette . sprinkle with pecans . serve immediately . vinaigrette can be made up to 3 days ahead . chill until ready to use.

name: coconut cream of tomato soup non dairy
description: i remember making a very buttery and creamy tomato soup and i craved it so intensely i finished it before eating any other food whatsoever . i wanted to make a non dairy version and i had the idea for coconut milk and saw there were other versions so here is mine.
ingredients: none none, none none, none none, none none, none none, none none, none none, none none, none none, none none, none none, none none, none none, none none, none none
steps: heat oil and add onions and garlic cook for a few minutes add all other base ingredients and heat through balance the dish experiments 1 lime juice instead of vinegar 2 finely chopped jicama 3 add heat with cayenne or fresh peppers

name: nian gao w/ red bean
description: typically a chinese new year type of dish, see https //en.wikipedia.org/wiki/nian gao for more info . recipe from my grandmother back when we all used to live in hawai'i . she would actually line a bowl/pot/container with ti leaves and then steam the mixture to cook it, and it comes out distinctly different this way i just haven't attempted to do it that way yet since i don't know all the details . 1. make sure you buy mochiko brand rice flour, no other kind . i bought a cheaper kind before and it tasted all funny and grainy in the end . 2. this may be obvious, but make sure it's red bean paste, not red bean . they look extremely similar via looking at the cans so just make sure you've got the paste . 3. machine blend everything, it doesn't matter how finely mixed it all is aside from being completely liquified . may be useful to mash up the red bean paste with a fork first don't use a spoon, it gets stuck in there . 4. use a giant bowl . i often underestimate how much crap ends up going into this mix and am left with a bowl filled to the brim . when i say giant, i mean like, wok size or greater . 5. if you forget to grease thoroughly the glass dish that you pour it in.. you're gonna end up butchering the entire thing when you wanna get it out to eat it . 6. mix the flour and brown sugar before you put in any liquids . 7. the mixture will be a light brown beige color when you pour it, which may be confusing since the gao is very dark when it's cooked.
ingredients: none none, none none, none none, none none, none none
steps: mix the rice flour, brown sugar in a large mixing bowl . mix in the water and coconut milk mix in the red bean paste . mix everything to a smooth texture machine mixer recommended . pour in a greased pan or pyrex glass pan, sprinkle top with sesame seeds optional . bake in 350 degree pre heated oven for 1.5 hours . remove, cool to room temperature, serve and enjoy

name: mashed sweet potato toasts with furikake
description: these mild, kid friendly toasts feature furikake, a japanese seasoning with bits of seaweed, sesame seeds, and other spices frequently used to add flavor to plain rice . while its unique flavor makes it well worth seeking out, you can substitute black sesame seeds if you prefer . the recipe is a yummly original created by jenn de la vega https //www.yummly.com/dish/author/jenn 20de 20la 20vega .
ingredients: 6.0 cup broth, 2.0 sweet potatoes, 1.0 tablespoon whipping cream, 2.0 tablespoon butter, 4.0 slice bread, 4.0 teaspoon furikake
steps: bring broth to a boil in a medium saucepan . add sweet potatoes, cover, and cook until soft, about 15 20 minutes . drain potatoes and return to pan . lightly mash until spreadable, but not completely smooth . stir in cream and butter . set aside . toast bread according to your favorite method . spread a thick layer of sweet potato mash on each toast . sprinkle a teaspoon of furikake on each toast.

name: skinny italian turkey meatballs
description: these lightened up italian turkey meatballs have been lightened up using ground turkey instead of beef . they are the perfect family friendly meal for any night of the week
ingredients: 20 oz 1.3 lb ground turkey breast 99 lean, 1/4 cup whole wheat seasoned breadcrumbs, 1/4 cup reggiano parmigiano cheese, 1/4 cup parsley, 1 egg, 1 large clove garlic, 1 tsp kosher salt fresh pepper, 2 tsp olive oil, 4 cloves garlic, 2 28 oz cans crushed tomatoes, 1/2 small onion, 1 bay leaf, 1 tsp oregano, 1/4 cup fresh chopped basil, salt and fresh pepper to taste
steps: in a medium size pot, heat olive oil over medium heat . add garlic and saute until golden, being careful not to burn . add crushed tomatoes, onion, salt, pepper, oregano, basil and bay leaf . stir and reduce heat to low . cover and let simmer on low 5 10 minutes . meanwhile, in a large bowl, combine ground turkey, breadcrumbs, egg, parsley, garlic and cheese . using wet hands, mix all the ingredients well until everything is combined . form small meatballs, about the size of a ping ping ball 1/8th cup each . add the meatballs to the sauce and cook about 20 minutes . discard the bay leaf and serve over pasta or on whole wheat italian bread for a meatball hero.

name: country style pot roast
description: country style pot roast with boneless beef pot roast, lipton recipe secrets onion soup mix, water, all potato purpos, carrots, all purpose flour
ingredients: 3.2 pound boneless beef pot roast, 1.0 envelope lipton recipe secrets onion soup mix, 2.5 cup water, 4.0 all potato purpos, 4.0 carrots, 3.0 tablespoon all purpose flour
steps: brown roast in dutch oven or 6 quart saucepot over medium high heat . add lipton recipe secrets onion soup mix blended with 2 cups water . bring to a boil over high heat . reduce heat to low and simmer covered, turning roast occasionally, 2 hours . add vegetables and cook an additional 30 minutes or until vegetables and roast are tender remove roast and vegetables . for gravy, blend remaining 1/2 cup water with flour stir into dutch oven . bring to a boil over high heat . reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered, stirring constantly, until thickened, about 5 minutes.

name: koffie ijs cupcakes
description: chocolade glazuur en cupcakes is bekend, maar de koffie ijs vulling maakt het recept bijzonder . je kan ook zelf cupcakes maken.
ingredients: 8.0 cupcakes, 100.0 gram chocoladeglazuur, 8.0 hertog koffie royaal, poedersuiker
steps: snijd de cupcakes overlangs middendoor . laat het chocoladeglazuur volgens de aanwijzingen op de verpakking smelten . schep op de onderste helften van de cupcakes een bolletje hertog koffie royaal ijs en zet de bovenste helften van de cupcakes erop . laat het chocoladeglazuur in een dun straaltje over de cupcakes lopen . bestuif met poedersuiker.

name: one bowl cranberry cheddar biscuits
description: flaky, mile high biscuits studded with cranberries and oozing with sharp cheddar cheese make a very special dinner roll, particularly when spread with butter . bonus set a runny egg on one and call it breakfast the recipe is a yummly original created by jessie sheehan https //www.yummly.com/dish/author/jessie sheehan .
ingredients: cooking oil spray, all purpose flour, 4.0 cup all purpose flour, 4.0 teaspoon baking powder, 0.2 teaspoon baking soda, 1.0 teaspoon salt, 0.5 teaspoon black pepper, 1.0 cup unsalted butter, 1.2 cup whole milk, 0.5 cup cranberries, 2.0 cup shredded sharp cheddar cheese, all purpose flour, all purpose flour, 1.0 large egg, 0.2 teaspoon salt, flaky sea salt, salted butter
steps: grease a 9 inch square pan with cooking oil spray . line the bottom with parchment paper or dust with flour, shaking out excess set pan aside . pro tip the biscuits will rise higher if they're baked snugly touching one another in a high sided pan . put flour, baking powder, soda, salt, and pepper in a large mixing bowl and whisk together . cut butter into small cubes and add to bowl . using a pastry blender, fork and knife, or your hands, rub butter into flour mixture until it resembles coarse meal . add milk and stir until a shaggy dough forms . pro tip easy does it for the most tender biscuits, combine wet and dry ingredients gently, mixing just until evenly blended . coarsely chop cranberries . add cheese and cranberries to dough and stir just until evenly distributed . lightly flour a work surface, set dough on it, and knead a few times until it's no longer crumbly and the dry and moist bits are fully integrated . if the dough is at all sticky, lightly flour your work surface again . gently pat dough into a rectangle about 1 1/4 inches thick . dip a 3 inch biscuit cutter into flour . cut biscuits from dough and place in prepared baking pan so they touch snugly . gather scraps, pat out again, and cut as needed . pro tip no biscuit cutter use a drinking glass to cut the rounds . wrap pan with biscuits in plastic wrap and freeze 2 hours . pro tip freezing the biscuits helps them keep their shape during baking . you can keep freeze them up to 1 month to bake whenever you like . preheat oven to 425degf . whisk egg and salt together in same measuring cup that you used to measure milk . brush biscuits with egg wash . sprinkle with sea salt . bake biscuits on middle rack of oven for 5 minutes . reduce heat to 400degf and bake until biscuits are well browned, 30 35 minutes more . check to see that biscuits are done . remove from oven or add time as needed . let biscuits cool slightly, then serve with butter.

name: grilled pork panini
description: grilled pork panini with pork chops, italian bread, pesto, provolone cheese, olive oil
ingredients: 3.0 pork chops, 8.0 slice italian bread, 0.5 cup pesto, 4.0 ounce provolone cheese, olive oil
steps: spread 1 tablespoon pesto on each slice of bread . top four slices of bread with sliced pork chops and cheese top each sandwich with remaining bread . lightly brush outer surface of sandwiches with olive oil grill in a medium hot skillet until toasted on each side.

name: home style pot roast
description: home style pot roast with vegetable oil, boneless beef chuck steak, onion, garlic, fresh thyme leaves, dry red wine, knorr homestyle stock beef, baby carrots, water
ingredients: 1.0 tablespoon vegetable oil, 2.8 pound boneless beef chuck steak, 3.0 onion, 2.0 clove garlic, 1.0 teaspoon fresh thyme leaves, 0.2 cup dry red wine, 1.0 knorr homestyle stock beef, 2.0 cup baby carrots, 1.3 cup water
steps: preheat oven 350deg . heat oil in large oven proof saucepot over medium high heat and brown beef . remove beef and set aside . reduce heat to medium and cook onions, stirring frequently, 8 minutes . stir in garlic and thyme and cook 1 minute . stir in wine, knorr homestyle stock beef and 1 cup water until stock is melted . return beef to saucepot . bake covered 2 hours . stir in carrots and bake an additional 30 minutes or until beef and carrots are tender . remove beef and carrots to serving platter and keep warm . to make gravy, combine 2 tablespoons all purpose flour with remaining 1/3 cup water in small bowl . stir into sauce with wire whisk and bring to a boil over high heat . reduce heat to medium and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened, about 5 minutes.

name: better than sex triple chocolate poke cake
description: if you want a dessert that will blow your taste buds away, you need to try my better than sex triple chocolate poke cake.
ingredients: 1.0 box fudge cake mix, 1.0 box chocolate instant pudding mix, 3.0 large eggs, 2.0 teaspoon pure vanilla extract, 1.0 cup milk, 0.5 cup vegetable oil, 0.5 cup sour cream, 1.0 jar sauce, 1.0 box chocolate instant pudding mix, 2.0 cup milk, 2.0 cup whipped topping, 1.0 hot chocolate mix
steps: preheat oven to 350degf . combine cake mix and dry pudding mix with eggs, vanilla extract, milk, vegetable oil and sour cream . beat on medium speed until well combined . bake cake in 9x13" for 20 22 minutes . check for doneness by inserting a toothpick into the middle of the cake . if the toothpick comes out clean, you cake is done . allow to cool for 10 minutes . while the cake is still warm, take the end of a wooden spoon or another round object and poke holes all over the top of your cake . heat the jar of hot fudge sauce in the microwave for about 30 seconds until you can stir it and thin it out . you may need an additional 30 seconds . pour the entire jar of hot fudge sauce on the top of cake and allow it to absorb in the cake until cake is cooled . let set until completely cooled . when the cake has cooled, prepare the pudding layer by mixing a package of instant dark chocolate pudding with 2 cups of cold milk . before the pudding sets, pour it over the top of the cake and put the cake in the fridge to let the pudding set, about 15 minutes . prepare the whipped cream . put the bowl and whisk attachment in the freezer for 5 10 minutes to get them really cold this step is optional, but a common practice i use . . in cold mixing bowl, pour in heavy whipping cream and beat on medium speed for about 3 minutes . add hot chocolate mix and increase speed to medium high . beat until stiff peak form . spread whipped cream over the top of cake . you can top you cake with a chocolate drizzle and some crushed white and milk chocolate chips, or any of your favorite chocolate goodies.

name: maple ginger roasted pork tenderloin
description: http //feedmephoebe.com/2014/06/maple ginger roasted teriyaki pork tenderloin recipe/
ingredients: 0.2 cup maple syrup, 0.2 cup gluten free tamari, 2.0 large garlic cloves, 2.0 inch fresh ginger root, 1.0 pound pork tenderloin
steps: in a small food processor, puree the maple syrup, tamari, garlic, and ginger until smooth . alternatively, you can mind the ginger and garlic by hand and whisk in the remaining ingredients . transfer the marinade to a resealable plastic bag . add the pork and swish around until coated . marinate in the refrigerator for at least an hour, preferably overnight . preheat the oven to 500 degrees . remove the pork from the marinade and set on a foil lined baking sheet . roast in the oven for approximately 20 minutes, until the pork is nicely browned on top . allow to rest on a cutting board for 10 minutes . meanwhile, transfer the remaining marinade to a small saucepan . cook on medium heat until reduced by half . slice the pork on the bias, drizzle with the reduced sauce, and serve immediately.

name: sumac chicken lemon israeli couscous
description: the middle east has so much to offer when it comes to food and spice . one of the most popular spices in the middle east is sumac . red, sour berries are harvested from the sumac bush then dried and ground into a coarse powder . in this recipe, we dust our chicken breasts with this tart and tangy spice . another gift from israel is couscous . there are several varieties of couscous, varying in origin and size of the pearl, but here we use the israeli variety . the couscous gets tossed with an assortment of veg and a tangy, lemony vinaigrette . take a trip to the middle east, in under 15 minutes
ingredients: 1.0 cup israeli couscous, 2.0 boneless skinless chicken breasts, 1.0 tablespoon sumac, 2.0 garlic cloves, 1.0 carrot, 1.0 head broccoli, 1.0 diced red onion, 1.0 lemon, 1.0 tablespoon mustard, 1.0 tablespoon grated parmesan, 2.0 tablespoon parsley, salt, olive oil, vinegar, fresh mint
steps: get a large pan going over medium high heat . fill about half way with hot water and salt heavily . add the couscous and cook for about 10 minutes . throw another large pan over medium high heat and drizzle with olive oil . grab your chicken breasts and season with salt and sumac . add the chicken to the pan, skin side down . now season the second side with salt and sumac . toss the whole garlic cloves into the pan as well . grate your carrot . now grate the broccoli, starting with the bottom, save the florets for another time . dice up your red onion . grab a large bowl to make the dressing . combine about 1 tablespoon of olive oil, 1 tablespoon of vinegar, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1 tablespoon mustard, a pinch of salt, and whisk to combine . add your veg to the bowl and toss . once the chicken has been on the skin side for about 5 minutes, it's time to flip it . strain the couscous and add about half the couscous to the salad save the rest for another day . grate your parm over the top . grab your lemon and slice off a couple of pieces of rind, leaving a bit of the flesh on each piece . then, finely chop the pieces and add to the salad . chop up the parsley and add to the salad . add a pile of couscous salad to the center of the plate . top with a chicken breast . garnish with a bit of torn parsley and a pinch of sumac . hot tip dressing ratio rule when dressing salads with leaves use a 3 to 1 ratio of oil to lemon, if no leaves are involved use a 2 to 1 ratio.

name: thai style lemongrass chicken and herb wraps
description: thai style lemongrass chicken and herb wraps with boneless skinless chicken breast, red onion, lemongrass, thai chiles, garlic cloves, kosher salt, coconut oil, fish sauce, lime juice, brown sugar, chile garlic sauce, baby romaine, butter lettuce leaves, persian cucumbers, fresh mint leaves, fresh cilantro, scallions, lime wedges
ingredients: 1.0 pound boneless skinless chicken breast, 0.7 cup red onion, 0.2 cup lemongrass, 3.0 thai chiles, 2.0 garlic cloves, 1.0 teaspoon kosher salt, 3.0 tablespoon coconut oil, 4.0 tablespoon fish sauce, 4.0 tablespoon lime juice, 2.0 tablespoon brown sugar, chile garlic sauce, baby romaine, butter lettuce leaves, persian cucumbers, fresh mint leaves, fresh cilantro, scallions, lime wedges
steps: stir together the chicken, the red onion, the lemongrass, the chiles, the garlic, and the salt in a medium bowl . fit the kitchenaid stand mixer with the food grinder attachment and the large holed blade, place a bowl under the grinder spout, and turn the stand mixer on to stir level . place the meat mixture into the food grinder feed, spoonful by spoonful, until it is all used up . increase the stand mixer speed to medium once you have most of the mixture in the grinder . set mixture aside until ready to cook keep it very cold until you're ready to cook it . place a large frying pan over medium high heat and add the oil . when the oil shimmers, add the meat mixture and stir to coat . cook the mixture, breaking it up into small, uniform pieces and cook until the chicken is cooked . meanwhile, combine the fish sauce, lime juice, brown sugar, and sriracha in a jar or bowl and shake or whisk to combine . add half of the lime juice mixture to the pan and stir to coat . remove the chicken mixture from the heat . add the chicken larb to a serving bowl along with as much of the additional lime juice as desired.

name: drop biscuit cobbler
description: kelly jaggers shares her family recipe for a delicious fruit cobbler with a lightly sweetened buttermilk drop biscuit topping . time tested family recipe.
ingredients: 10 medium peaches, 1 pint fresh blueberries, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/4 cup all purpose flour, 1 tsp vanilla extract, pinch of kosher salt, 1 tbsp butter, 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour, 1/4 cup sugar, 2 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp kosher salt, 1/4 tsp cinnamon, 6 tbsp unsalted butter, 3/4 cup buttermilk, 1/2 tsp vanilla extract
steps: heat the oven to 350degf and spray a 9x9 inch baking dish with non stick cooking spray . in a large bowl combine the peaches, blueberries, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/4 cup flour, 1 teaspoon vanilla and a pinch of salt . toss gently to evenly coat the fruit . pour the fruit into the baking dish . dot the top of the fruit with 1 tbsp butter cut into small pieces and set aside . in a medium bowl combine 1 1/2 cups flour, 2 tablespoons of the sugar, baking powder, baking soda, 1/2 tsp salt and cinnamon . whisk the dry ingredients to evenly combine then add 6 tablespoons cubed butter . with your fingers, rub the butter into the flour mixture until it resembles coarse sand with no large chunks of butter remaining . make a well into the center of the dry ingredients and add the buttermilk and 1/2 teaspoon vanilla . mix until the dry ingredients are just moistened, about 8 10 strokes . scoop the biscuit batter into the cobbler in 12 16 even dollops . sprinkle the remaining 2 tablespoons sugar over the tops of the biscuits, then bake for 35 40 minutes, or until the biscuits are golden brown and the fruit filling is bubbling all over . remove from the oven and cool for at least 1 hour before serving.

name: chilled greek yogurt soup
description: simple no cook chilled soup with greek yogurt, cucumbers and fresh dill . perfect for spring and summer, cool and refreshing . kosher, dairy.
ingredients: 3 cups whole or lowfat 2 greek yogurt, 2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil, 1 2 cups lowfat milk, 1 lb persian cucumbers, 1/3 cup fresh chopped dill, 1 tsp crushed garlic, 1/2 tsp salt, white pepper to taste, fresh mint sprigs or roughly chopped mint for garnish, freshly squeezed lemon juice, chopped walnuts
steps: in a large bowl, whisk together greek yogurt, extra virgin olive oil and milk . start with 1 cup of milk then gradually continue adding more, whisking after each addition, till the yogurt takes on a soupy consistency . i stop adding milk when it reaches the texture of split pea soup . you can adjust the consistency according to your preference . grate the persian cucumbers into a separate bowl . wrap the cucumbers in cheesecloth or a clean tea towel and squeeze to remove excess moisture.stir the cucumbers into the yogurt along with the dill, garlic, salt and white pepper . adjust seasoning to taste . place in the refrigerator to chill for at least 1 hour, up to 4 hours . whisk the soup once more before serving, adding milk to loosen the texture if required and adjusting seasoning as needed . ladle chilled soup into bowls . top each serving with chopped mint or a mint sprig . optionally, you can stir in a bit of fresh lemon juice to brighten the flavor, or top with chopped walnuts for a sweet and nutty crunch . serve chilled.

name: chicken and rice soup chao ga
description: chicken and rice soup chao ga is the breakfast of champions, vietnamese style chao, called congee in english, jook in cantonese, zhou in mandarin, kanji in tamil, and more, depending on which country you are in, is one of the simplest recipes in the asian repertoire . the most basic version is made with white rice and water, simmered together until the rice breaks down and the mixture thickens . other versions call for red rice, brown rice, or starchy short grain rice . some have meat and bits of fish cooked in them others are left plain and are garnished at the table . the amount of time you simmer the rice in the water from 20 minutes to 2 hours determines the final texture of your porridge . in the south, there is a particular style of porridge where the rice is cooked in a large quantity of rich stock just until tender, but not thick . it's typically served with meat and ginger dipping sauce on the side.
ingredients: 3.0 pound chicken, 6.0 whole scallions, 1.0 piece fresh ginger, 1.0 tablespoon kosher salt, 1.0 cup jasmine rice, 3.0 quart chicken stock, 1.0 fresh ginger, ground black pepper, scallions, chopped fresh cilantro, roasted peanuts, fried shallots, doughnuts
steps: bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat . add the chicken, scallions, ginger, and salt and boil for 15 minutes, then turn off the heat, cover the pot, and let stand for 15 minutes . if your chicken is larger than 3 pounds, let stand 10 minutes longer . just before the chicken is ready, prepare a large ice water bath . when the chicken is done, remove it from the pot and immediately submerge it in the ice water bath, which will stop the cooking and give the meat a firmer texture . let stand 20 minutes until the chicken is cool enough to handle easily, then remove from the water and pat dry . pull the chicken meat from the bones, discarding the bones and skin . shred the meat with your fingers you should have about 4 cups . reserve 2 cups of the chicken cooking water and strain through a fine mesh strainer discard the remaining cooking liquid . discard bones and skin and set meat aside . this can be done a day ahead . while the chicken is cooking, prepare the rice . place the rice in a fine mesh sieve and rinse well under cold running water . in a large pot, combine the rice, stock, ginger, and the 2 cups reserved chicken cooking water . bring to a boil over high heat, lower the heat to a simmer, then cook, uncovered, for 1 hour . the rice will have broken down and the mixture will have a porridge like consistency . season to taste with salt . to ready the garnishes, put the scallions, cilantro, peanuts, fried shallots, and doughnut slices in separate small bowls . ladle the porridge into warmed bowls . top each serving with an equal amount of the chicken and a pinch of pepper . pass the garnishes at the table.

name: black and white ice cream sandwiches
description: black and white ice cream sandwiches with breyers natural vanilla ice cream, breyers chocolate ice cream, vanilla wafer cookies, crushed, frozen whipped topping, thawed, chocolate syrup
ingredients: 4.0 scoop breyers natural vanilla ice cream, 4.0 scoop breyers chocolate ice cream, 8.0 vanilla wafer cookies, crushed, 0.5 cup frozen whipped topping, thawed, 1.5 tablespoon chocolate syrup
steps: on bottom of 4 cookies, place 1 scoop each breyers all natural vanilla and chocolate ice cream, then gently press on remaining cookies, bottom side down . evenly top with whipped cream, then drizzle with chocolate syrup . on cookie sheet, arrange ice cream sandwiches cover and freeze 1 hour or until ready to serve.

name: orange beef and caramelized fennel with wilted spinach
description: orange beef and caramelized fennel with wilted spinach with promise buttery spread, sirloin steak, fennel, sweet onion, salt, fat free reduced sodium beef broth, orange juice, cornstarch, baby spinach leaves
ingredients: 6.0 teaspoon promise buttery spread, 0.5 pound sirloin steak, 1.0 fennel, 1.0 sweet onion, 0.2 teaspoon salt, 1.0 can fat free reduced sodium beef broth, 0.2 cup orange juice, 1.0 tablespoon cornstarch, 6.0 cup baby spinach leaves
steps: in 12 inch nonstick skillet, melt 2 teaspoons promise buttery spread over medium heat and brown steak, about 3 minutes . remove and keep warm . in same skillet, melt remaining spread over medium heat . add fennel, onion and salt and cook, stirring occasionally, 13 minutes or until tender . stir in broth blended with orange juice and cornstarch . bring to a boil over high heat . reduce heat to low and simmer 4 minutes or until thickened . stir in beef and spinach until spinach is wilted . serve, if desired, over hot cooked brown rice.

name: japanese curry rec . 2
description: http //www.seriouseats.com/recipes/2010/06/how to make japanese curry rice from scratch recipe.html
ingredients: chicken, onions
steps: see link

name: shrimp ceviche cocktail
description: shrimp cocktail is fine, but when i want something special, i like to have my zesty lime shrimp ceviche style
ingredients: 1/4 cup chopped red onion, 2 small limes, 1 tsp olive oil, 1 lb large cooked, peeled shrimp, 1 medium hass avocado, 1 medium tomato, 1 cup diced english cucumber, 1 serrano pepper, 2 tbsp chopped cilantro, salt and fresh black pepper to taste, 1 lime cut into wedges for serving, 2 1/4 cups shredded iceberg lettuce
steps: in a small bowl combine red onion, lime juice, olive oil, pinch of salt and pepper . let them marinate at least 5 minutes to mellow the flavor of the onion . in a large bowl combine shrimp, avocado, tomato, cucumber, serrano pepper . combine all the ingredients together, add cilantro and gently toss . adjust salt and pepper to taste . fill nine martini glasses with shredded lettuce . top each with 1/2 cup shrimp salad and garnish with a sprig of cilantro . serve with a wedge of lime.

name: black tie sundaes
description: black tie sundaes with firmly packed light brown sugar, light corn syrup, heavy or whipping cream, i can't believe it's not butter spread, semi sweet chocolate chips, instant coffee, breyers natural vanilla ice cream, breyers chocolate ice cream, heavy or whipping cream, chocolate wafer cookies, crumbled
ingredients: 0.3 cup firmly packed light brown sugar, 0.2 cup light corn syrup, 0.2 cup heavy or whipping cream, 3.0 tablespoon i can't believe it's not butter spread, 0.3 cup semi sweet chocolate chips, 0.5 teaspoon instant coffee, 1.0 cup breyers natural vanilla ice cream, 1.0 cup breyers chocolate ice cream, none heavy or whipping cream, none chocolate wafer cookies, crumbled
steps: bring brown sugar, corn syrup, heavy cream and spread to a boil over high heat in 2 quart saucepan, stirring frequently . reduce heat to low and cook, without stirring, 6 minutes or until thickened remove from heat . stir in chocolate chips until melted with wire whisk . stir in coffee mixture cool slightly . to serve, spoon 2 tablespoons sauce into 4 wide mouthed champagne or martini glasses . evenly top with scoops of breyers all natural vanilla and chocolate ice cream . drizzle with additional sauce, then garnish with whipped cream and cookies.

name: pumpkin butterscotch cookie bars
description: these pumpkin butterscotch bars cookie bars are the perfect fall dessert moist and chewy, made lighter with pumpkin puree and studded with butterscotch chips.
ingredients: 2 cups all purpose flour, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/4 tsp salt, 1 1/2 tsp pumpkin pie spice, 1/8 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 2/3 cup granulated sugar, 2/3 cup brown sugar, 1/4 cup melted unsalted butter, 2 large egg whites, 1/4 cup pumpkin puree, 2 tsp pure vanilla extract, 2/3 cup butterscotch chips, 8 oz 1/3 less fat cream cheese, 1/2 cup powdered sugar, 2 ounces melted semi sweet chocolate, 1/2 tsp vanilla extract
steps: preheat oven to 350degf . lightly spray a 9 x 13 inch non stick baking pan with cooking spray . in a large bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, salt, pumpkin spice and cinnamon and stir to blend . in another bowl, whisk the sugars with the butter, egg whites, pumpkin and vanilla until light and fluffy . whisk the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients in two additions until the batter is very well blended . if the batter looks more "crumbly" than smooth, add just a drop of water at a time only if needed until it smooths out . fold in butterscotch chips . spread batter onto the baking pan using the back of a measuring cup to smooth evenly . bake 14 16 minutes, until the edges are light brown and a toothpick inserted comes out clean . don't over bake or your bars will be dry . let it cool completely on wire rack . meanwhile, prepare the frosting in a large bowl, use an electric mixer to beat the cream cheese, powdered sugar and vanilla until well blended . frost bars and drizzle with the melted chocolate . to melt the chocolate, place in a microwave safe cup and heat 15 seconds stir . another 15 seconds stir until the chocolate is melted . when the chocolate sets, cut into 15 large squares 5 cuts by 3 cuts with the knife . then cut each square in half diagonally to create triangles . store in the refrigerator until ready to serve.

name: when pigs fly appetizer
description: reminiscent of buffalo wings, these bite sized pieces of tender pork are bathed in spicy hot sauce.
ingredients: 4.0 boneless pork chops, 2.0 teaspoon vegetable oil, 14.0 ounce ketchup, 3.0 tablespoon honey, 2.0 tablespoon lemon juice, 3.0 teaspoon hot pepper sauce, 1.0 teaspoon dried thyme, 0.5 teaspoon dried rosemary, 0.5 teaspoon lemon pepper
steps: in large skillet heat oil over medium high heat . cook and stir pork cubes for 4 5 minutes or until pork is just done . remove excess fat from skillet reduce heat to low . add remaining ingredients to skillet, stirring to coat pork cubes . cover and cook about 1 minute or until heated through . transfer to warm serving dish serve with toothpicks.

name: instant pot chicken parmesan
description: this quick and easy chicken parmesan is the answer to your weeknight dreams and since it's made in the instant pot, it's ready in minutes
ingredients: 1 teaspoon extra virgin olive oil, 2 garlic cloves, 1 1/2 cups prepared marinara sauce, 3 tablespoons grated parmesan cheese, freshly ground black pepper, 4 thin chicken cutlets, 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano, 4 ounces fresh mozzarella cheese, chopped basil
steps: using the saute function on low, if possible, heat the oil in the pressure cooker pot . stir in the garlic and cook until just turning golden, about 2 minutes . stir in the marinara sauce, 2 tablespoons of the parmesan, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper . increase the saute heat to medium . season the chicken with the salt, oregano, and pepper to taste . nestle the cutlets into the sauce, overlapping as little as possible, then spoon the sauce over to cover the chicken . lock the lid into place and cook on low pressure for 3 minutes . manually release the pressure . sprinkle the mozzarella and the remaining 1 tablespoon parmesan evenly over the chicken . cover the pot with the lid but don't lock it on and let it sit for 4 to 5 minutes to melt the cheese . serve as is or, for deeper flavors and a little bit of crispiness, broil the cheese until golden and bubbling heat the broiler with a rack 4 inches from the heat source . scoop the chicken and sauce into a greased small rimmed baking sheet, trying to keep the cheese on top . broil until the cheese has browned, 2 to 3 minutes . sprinkle with basil, if desired.

name: japanse tartaartjes met roergebakken spitskool
description: dit recept spitskool is anders dan anders doordat we saus maken van het japanse wereldgerecht van knorr . we bakken tartaar van biefstuk waardoor het recept snel klaar is namelijk in 25 minuten.
ingredients: 1.0 packet knorr wereldgerecht japanse teriyaki, 5.0 tablespoon conimex wokolie, 4.0 piece tartaar, 2.0 rode uien, 1.0 bag bosui, 300.0 gram spitskool, 150.0 gram champignons, 1.0 bag conimex kroepoek cassave, 1.0 jar mangochutney
steps: meng in een diep bord de marinademix uit het knorr wereldgerecht japanse teriyaki pakket met 2 eetlepels conimex wokolie en wentel de tartaartjes erdoor . laat ze zo minstens 5 minuten marineren, keer ze regelmatig . kook de rijst uit het pakket gaar volgens de aanwijzingen op de verpakking . pel de rode uien en snijd ze in dunne partjes . snijd de bosuien in stukken van 3 cm . verhit 3 eetlepels wokolie in een wok en roerbak hierin de spitskool met champignons, rode ui en bosui in 3 4 minuten beetgaar . voeg 350 ml water en de sausmix uit het pakket toe en breng het al roerende aan de kook . laat de groente nog 2 3 minuten zachtjes sudderen . bak de tartaartjes met hun marinade zonder extra olie in een koekenpan in 4 6 minuten bruin en gaar . serveer de tartaartjes met de roergebakken spitskool en de japanse rijst . geef de conimex kroepoek cassave en mangochutney er apart bij.

name: chocolade paasbakjes met 3 chocolade ijs
description: een grandioos chocolade recept met pure chocolade gemaakte paasbakjes en hertog 3 chocolades ijs . chocola is altijd een geslaagd toetje.
ingredients: 300.0 gram chocolade, 50.0 gram cornflakes, 25.0 deciliter slagroom, 3.0 tablespoon advocaat, 4.0 bulb hertog 3 chocolades, chocolade paaseitjes, olie, ui
steps: smelt de chocolade au bain marie of in de magnetron . meng de cornflakes door de chocolade . zet 4 schaaltjes op zijn kop en bekleed de buitenkant met plastic folie . verdeel het chocolademengsel over de kommen . druk het goed aan, zodat er kommetjes van chocolade ontstaan . laat ze hard worden in de koelkast . klop intussen de slagroom met de advocaat en schep het mengsel in een spuitzak . haal de chocoladebakjes van de schaaltjes en schep in elk kommetje een royale bol hertog 3 chocolades ijs . garneer met advocaatroom en chocolade eitjes.

name: grilled ham steaks with apricot glaze
description: your whole family will love this delicious grilled ham with a sweet apricot glaze . it is quick preparation makes it a great choice for a weekday meal . serve with grilled vegetable kabobs, crispy half baked potatoes and homemade ice cream.
ingredients: 1.0 pound boneless ham, 0.2 cup apricot jam, 2.0 teaspoon dijon style mustard, 2.0 teaspoon cider vinegar
steps: in a small bowl, mix together well the jam, mustard and vinegar . grill ham slices over hot coals, brushing with apricot basting sauce occasionally and turning once, until nicely browned, about 8 10 minutes total . serve immediately.

name: easy baked ziti
description: this dinnertime favorite is easy to make, feeds a crowd, and is great for making ahead or freezing . the recipe is a yummly original created by sara mellas https //www.yummly.com/dish/author/sara 20mellas .
ingredients: nonstick cooking spray, 1.0 pound ziti, teaspoon salt, 1.0 pound 85 lean ground beef, 0.5 teaspoon salt, 0.2 teaspoon black pepper, 1.0 teaspoon garlic powder, 1.5 teaspoon italian seasoning, 4.0 cup marinara sauce, 24.0 ounce low moisture ricotta cheese, 0.5 cup grated parmesan cheese, 0.5 teaspoon salt, 0.2 teaspoon black pepper, 0.5 teaspoon garlic powder, 1.0 teaspoon italian seasoning, 12.0 ounce shredded mozzarella cheese
steps: preheat the oven to 375degf . spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray . set aside . bring a large pot of water to a boil . add a generous pinch of salt . once boiling, add the ziti to the water . cook, stirring occasionally, until the pasta is al dente, 9 10 minutes . drain the pasta in a large colander, and rinse thoroughly with cold water . while the pasta cooks, prepare the meat sauce . spray an extra large skillet generously with nonstick cooking spray, then set over medium high heat . add the ground beef, salt, black pepper, garlic powder, and italian seasoning to the skillet . cook the beef, breaking it up with a spatula, until lightly browned, 4 5 minutes . drain the fat from the skillet . return the skillet to the stove, and reduce heat to medium low . pour the marinara sauce over the meat and stir to combine . cover and simmer for 2 3 minutes . while the sauce simmers, prepare the cheese mixture . place the ricotta, parmesan, salt, black pepper, garlic powder, and italian seasoning in a large mixing bowl . stir with a rubber spatula to thoroughly combine . return the drained ziti to the pot . add the meat sauce and stir to thoroughly coat the noodles . transfer 1/3 of the sauced pasta to the prepared baking dish . drop half the ricotta mixture by spoonfuls over the ziti, and gently spread it into an even layer . sprinkle 1 cup mozzarella cheese over the ricotta . repeat with another 1/3 of the noodles, the remaining ricotta, and another cup of mozzarella cheese . top with the last 1/3 of noodles . sprinkle the last cup of mozzarella cheese in an even layer over the top of the dish . cover the baking dish with a sheet of aluminum foil . bake the spaghetti on middle rack of oven for 40 minutes . remove the aluminum foil and continue baking until cheese on top is golden brown, 15 minutes . check to see that ziti is done . remove from oven or add time as needed . allow the ziti to rest for 20 minutes before serving.

name: steak and arugula salad
description: steak and arugula salad with wish bone, boneless flank steak, arugula leaves, red onion, grape tomatoes, bread
ingredients: 1.0 cup wish bone, 0.8 pound boneless flank steak, 8.0 cup arugula leaves, 0.5 cup red onion, 1.0 cup grape tomatoes, 4.0 slice bread
steps: pour 1/2 cup wish bone robusto italian dressing over steak in large, shallow nonaluminum baking dish or plastic bag turn to coat . cover, or close bag, and marinate in refrigerator, turning occasionally, 3 to 24 hours . remove steak from marinade, discarding marinade . grill or broil steak, turning once and brushing with 1/4 cup dressing, until steak is desired doneness . toss arugula and onion with remaining 1/4 cup dressing in large bowl . top with thinly sliced steak and drizzle, if desired, with additional dressing . serve with bread.

name: creamy grape dessert
description: warning this dessert is highly addictive and hard to stop eating don't be fooled by the humble ingredients, this is easy to make, very refreshing, and is perfect to bring to a bbq . truthfully, the first time i heard of this grape dessert, the ingredients did not appeal to me . but when i tasted it, omg this is one of those recipes you'll be making again and again and chances are you probably have all the ingredients in your kitchen . easily doubles for more people.
ingredients: 1 lb green seedless grapes, 1 lb red seedless grapes, 8 oz fat free chobani greek yogurt, 4 oz light cream cheese, 1/4 cup agave, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 tbsp brown sugar, 1/2 cup chopped walnuts
steps: cut grapes in half and set aside . mix yogurt, cream cheese, agave and vanilla until blended well . stir grapes into mixture, and pour in large serving dish . combine brown sugar and crushed walnuts . sprinkle over top of grapes to cover completely . chill until ready to serve.

name: lasagna formaggio
description: lasagna formaggio with ricotta cheese, shredded mozzarella cheese, eggs, mccormick garlic powder, mccormick perfect pinch italian seasoning, mccormick parsley flakes, salt, mccormick black pepper, marinara sauce, water, lasagna noodles, grated parmesan cheese
ingredients: 2.0 container ricotta cheese, 2.0 cup shredded mozzarella cheese, 2.0 eggs, 1.0 teaspoon mccormick garlic powder, 1.0 teaspoon mccormick perfect pinch italian seasoning, 1.0 teaspoon mccormick parsley flakes, 0.5 teaspoon salt, 0.2 teaspoon mccormick black pepper, 26.0 ounce marinara sauce, 0.5 cup water, 9.0 lasagna noodles, 0.2 cup grated parmesan cheese
steps: preheat oven to 350degf . mix ricotta cheese, 1 1/2 cups of the mozzarella cheese, eggs, garlic powder, italian seasoning, parsley, salt and pepper in large bowl until well blended . pour marinara sauce into medium bowl . pour water into empty jar cover and shake well . add to marinara sauce mix well . spread about 1 cup of the sauce on the bottom of 13x9 inch baking dish . top with 3 of the lasagna noodles . spread 1/2 of the cheese mixture over noodles . repeat sauce, noodles and cheese layer once . top with remaining noodles and sauce, making sure to cover noodles with sauce . sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup mozzarella cheese and parmesan cheese . cover with foil . bake 45 minutes . remove foil . bake 15 minutes longer or until noodles are tender . let stand 15 minutes before cutting . serve with additional marinara sauce, if desired.

name: irish soda bread
description: with no yeast required and minimal kneading involved, irish soda bread is a simple to make treat and delicious when fresh out of the oven . just see if you can make this loaf last longer than a day the recipe is a yummly original created by sara mellas https //www.yummly.com/dish/author/sara 20mellas .
ingredients: all purpose flour, 4.2 cup all purpose flour, 0.2 cup granulated sugar, 1.0 teaspoon baking soda, 1.0 teaspoon salt, 0.2 cup butter, 0.5 cup dried currants, 1.8 cup buttermilk, 1.0 large egg, all purpose flour
steps: preheat oven to 425degf . flour a 9 or 10 inch cast iron skillet, or line a baking sheet with parchment paper . place the flour, sugar, baking soda, and salt in a large mixing bowl . mix with a rubber spatula to combine . using the coarse holes of a box grater or hand grater, grate butter directly into the bowl of flour . add currants or raisins to the bowl . gently mix with a rubber spatula to distribute butter pieces and dried fruit . whisk together buttermilk and egg in a medium bowl, then pour over the flour butter mixture . gently mix the wet ingredients into the dry with a rubber spatula, working until they combine in a tacky dough . turn dough onto a well floured work surface . shape dough into a round loaf, and use a sharp knife to score an "x" into the top . carefully transfer loaf to the center of the floured skillet . bake loaf on middle rack of oven until it is golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped, 40 45 minutes . check to see that bread is done . remove from oven or add time as needed . allow bread to cool for at least 1 hour before slicing and serving . leftover irish soda bread can be kept in an airtight container for up to 3 days, or frozen for 3 months.

name: cold kiwi cream dessert
description: kiwi is an underrated fruit, especially when it comes to adding it to anything other than fruit salad . in this recipe, kiwi is the star . with just three other ingredients and a grand total of 25 minutes need to prepare, this is sure to be a go to recipe . the wiki is blended with plain yogurt and honey to create a smooth cream . a quick set in the refrigerator is all it needs before you can serve . try it topped with a dallop of whipped cream or some sliced strawberries for a healthy dessert.
ingredients: 4.0 kiwi fruits, 500.0 milliliter plain yogurt, 1.0 tablespoon honey, sugar
steps: add the kiwi fruits, yogurt, honey, and pinch of sugar to a blender . puree until smooth and add more sugar if needed . serve cold.

name: lemon asparagus couscous salad with tomatoes
description: pearl couscous otherwise known as isreali couscous tossed with asparagus, tomatoes and lemon juice make a vibrant spring pasta salad that is perfect for lunch, as a side dish, or even to make as a side dish if you are grilling for mother's day this weekend
ingredients: 6 oz whole wheat pearl couscous, 3/4 lb thin asparagus spears, 1 1/2 cups grape tomatoes, 1/4 cup red onion, 1 1/2 lemons, 1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil, 2 tbsp fresh parsley, kosher salt, fresh cracked pepper
steps: bring a large pot of salted water to a boil, add asparagus and cook until tender, about 3 minutes . remove with a large slotted spoon and rinse in a colander in the sink under cold water to stop it from cooking . add the couscous to the boiling water and cook according to package directions . chop the asparagus into small 1/2 inch pieces . drain the couscous and rinse under cold water, place in a large bowl . add the chopped asparagus, tomatoes, red onion, lemon juice, olive oil, parsley, salt and pepper to the bowl . taste for salt and pepper and serve room temperature or chilled.

name: japanese yakisoba noodles recipe
description: yakisoba is a classic japanese street food made by stir frying boiled ramen noodles, vegetables and meat or seafood with a sweet and savoury sauce . in japan, yakisoba can be found sizzling away in stalls everywhere from baseball stadiums to traditional omatsuri festivals . if you've ever been to an event in japan, you probably remember the smell of the fruity, spicy sauce caramelizing on giant teppan cast iron griddles with the noodles . just follow our recipe step by step and you too can make this appetising dish . it's a wholesome meal with veggies and meat/seafood, but without the carbs you find in regular yakisoba . one serving of this recipe gives you 467 calories . enjoy
ingredients: 1.0 noodles, 2.0 tablespoon vegetable oil, shiitake mushrooms, pork belly, carrot, onion, cabbage, spring onions, 3.0 tablespoon chuno sauce, 0.5 tablespoon oyster sauce, 0.2 tablespoon ground white pepper, 5.0 gram katsuobushi, pickle, aonori
steps: prepare slim noodles as per package instructions drained and rinsed . in a small bowl, whisk together the chuno sauce, oyster sauce, and white pepper . heat the oil in a pan over medium high heat until hot and then pan fry the pork and set aside . in the same pan add carrots, onions and any tougher bits of cabbage . stir fry until the carrots are tender and then add the spring onions and remaining cabbage . continue stir frying until cabbage is cooked . add the noodles and sauce, using tongs to lift and drop the noodles like tossing a salad to coat them evenly with sauce . sprinkle the katsuobushi onto the noodles, and continue tossing until the noodles are a uniform colour and you can smell the sauce starting to caramelize . add the pork and toss . 8. plate the yakisoba and sprinkle with aonori and beni shoga to garnish.

name: paella met sardientjes
description: paella met sardientjes with chorizo, broccoliroosjes, bertolli classico olijfolie, kipblokjes, prei, knorr wereldgerecht spaanse paella, paprika, sardientjes, olijven
ingredients: 100.0 gram chorizo, 250.0 gram broccoliroosjes, 3.0 tablespoon bertolli classico olijfolie, 300.0 gram kipblokjes, 250.0 gram prei, 1.0 packet knorr wereldgerecht spaanse paella, 1.0 paprika, 2.0 can sardientjes, 1.0 jar olijven
steps: snijd de chorizo in kleine stukjes en verdeel de broccoli in kleinere roosjes . verhit 2 eetlepels olijfolie in een wok en bak de chorizo hierin even uit . schep de kip erdoor en bak de blokjes al omscheppend bruin . roerbak de broccoli en prei 2 minuten mee . voeg 400 ml water, de rijst en de kruidenmix uit het pakket toe . breng dit aan de kook en roer er de groentenmix uit het pakket doorheen . kook de paella afgedekt in 15 minuten zachtjes gaar . snijd de paprika in repen . verhit 1 eetlepel olijfolie in een koekenpan en bak de paprikarepen zachtjes gaar . dep de sardientjes droog met keukenpapier . laat de olijven in een zeef uitlekken . leg de sardientjes, paprika en olijven op de paella en geef er een frisse salade bij.

name: coconut macaroon pumpkin pie
description: make a delicious gluten free, dairy free pumpkin pie with sweet coconut macaroon crust . dairy free, gluten free recipe, tastes amazing
ingredients: 2 1/2 cups shredded unsweetened coconut, 1/2 cup sugar, 1 1/2 tbsp potato starch or corn starch, 1/4 tsp salt, 4 large egg whites, plus one additional egg white, separated, 1 tsp vanilla, 2 cups pumpkin puree, 1 cup full fat coconut milk, 2 large eggs, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1 1/2 tsp vanilla, 1 1/2 tsp cinnamon, 1/4 tsp ground ginger, 1/4 tsp nutmeg, 1/4 tsp salt, pinch cloves
steps: preheat oven to 325 degrees . in a mixing bowl, stir together coconut, potato starch, sugar and salt until thoroughly combined . in a separate bowl, whisk together 4 egg whites and vanilla until frothy . pour egg mixture into coconut mixture and allow to sit for 20 30 minutes . generously grease a 9 inch pie dish with non stick cooking spray and evenly press in the macaroon crust mixture . cover edge of the crust with aluminum foil and bake for 45 minutes.meanwhile, whisk remaining egg white with 1/2 tbsp of water . when crust has finished baking, remove from oven . brush crust with egg white to create a seal . after brushing on the egg white, put the protective foil back around the edge of the crust . bake for an additional 10 15 minutes till the crust is golden brown.

name: mock whitebait
description: people all around the world have consumed eel as a delicacy and many believe that it gives people that "summer glow." this dish pairs this highly nutritional fish with a crunchy coating, and tops it off with sweet lemon juice . a twist on the classic calamari can switch up any summer party . ready in only 25 minutes, this fun appetizer will be gone before you have time to make the next batch
ingredients: 1.0 can baby eels, 2.0 tablespoon flour, oil, salt, ground black pepper, 1.0 lime
steps: place the baby eels and flour in a resealable plastic bag . close the bag and shake it vigorously . open the bag and make sure the eel is covered with the flour . fry the eels in plenty of hot oil for 30 seconds . remove the excess oil with paper towel . season with salt and black pepper . serve with lime wedges.

name: ei mini pannetje uit de oven
description: http //www.chowie.nl/ei uit een mini pannetje/
ingredients: egg, 2.0 creamcheese, 0.5 tomato, smoked salmon, olive oil, pepper
steps: preheat oven 180 degrees put all except herbs in oven for 15 minutes, without lid remove from oven, add herbs and lid . serve.

name: quick and easy eggplant naan pizzas
description: tender slices of eggplant and creamy dollops of ricotta make these naan pizzas perfect for when you're craving eggplant parmesan with a little extra something . the recipe is a yummly original created by sara mellas https //www.yummly.com/dish/author/sara 20mellas .
ingredients: 4.0 piece naan, 2.0 teaspoon olive oil, 1.0 small eggplant, 4.0 basil leaves, 0.7 cup pizza sauce, 1.0 cup mozzarella cheese, 4.0 ounce ricotta cheese, 2.0 tablespoon shaved parmesan cheese
steps: preheat oven to 425degf . line a baking sheet with parchment paper . arrange the naan on the baking sheet . drizzle an equal amount of the olive oil over the surface of each piece . thinly slice the eggplant into 1/8 inch thick rounds . cut each round in half . stack the basil leaves and roll into a tight log . make very thin slices across the log to create ribbons . divide the pizza sauce equally on each naan piece and spread it into an even layer, leaving a 1/2 inch border around the sauce . spread eggplant slices evenly over each piece of naan, then add a sprinkling of shredded cheese, drops of ricotta cheese, and half of the basil ribbons . reserve remaining basil for garnish . bake the pizzas on middle rack of oven until the naan is crisp and the cheese is bubbly and golden, 14 15 minutes . check to see that pizzas are done . remove from oven or add time as needed . allow pizzas to cool on the baking sheet for 2 3 minutes . top with reserved basil ribbons and a sprinkle of parmesan cheese, if desired . slice and serve . refrigerate leftovers in an airtight container for up to 2 days . reheat in the oven at 350degf for 5 7 minutes.

name: poppyseed chicken casserole
description: magically delicious
ingredients: 2.0 ritz crackers, 1.0 stick butter, 2.0 tablespoon poppy seeds, 2.0 cup diced chicken, 8.0 ounce sour cream, 1.0 can cream of mushroom soup
steps: combine crackers, poppyseeds and butter for crust, reserving 1 cup for topping put crust in baking dish, press it in firmly to make a crust . mx chicken soup and sour cream and pour over crust, topping with reserved crust bake 35 minutes at 350

name: mexican meatballs
description: this recipe is courtesy of isabel eats https //www.isabeleats.com/ . juicy mexican pork meatballs covered in an addicting roasted tomato and smoky chipotle sauce . ready from start to finish in only 40 minutes, they make a delicious weeknight dinner served over rice, veggies, or in a sandwich
ingredients: 1.0 pound ground pork, 0.5 cup plain breadcrumbs, 1.0 egg, 0.2 medium onion, 2.0 clove garlic, 1.0 teaspoon coarse kosher salt, 0.5 teaspoon ground cumin, 0.5 teaspoon ground coriander, 1.5 tablespoon olive oil, 8.0 roma tomatoes, 3.0 clove garlic, 2.0 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, 1.0 teaspoon coarse kosher salt, 0.2 teaspoon mexican oregano, chopped cilantro
steps: line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and place tomatoes on top . set the oven rack directly underneath the broiler and turn the broiler on high . broil the tomatoes for 3 4 minutes, or until the skin is blackened and blistered . carefully flip over the tomatoes and broil for another 3 4 minutes, or until the skin is blackened and blistered on all sides . remove from the oven and set aside . preheat the oven to 450degf . add ground pork, breadcrumbs, egg, onion, 2 cloves garlic, 1 tsp salt, cumin, and coriander to a large mixing bowl . gently combine using your hands until everything is just mixed . be careful not to overmix or they may come out tough . shape the mixture into 16 meatballs and set aside . heat olive oil in a large cast iron skillet or other oven safe skillet over medium high heat . add meatballs to the skillet and sear until golden brown on one side, about 1 2 minutes . flip the meatballs over and transfer the skillet to the oven . bake for 8 minutes, or until the internal temperature of the meatballs reach 160f . while meatballs are baking, add the roasted tomatoes, 3 cloves garlic, chipotle peppers, adobo sauce, oregano, and 1 tsp salt to a large blender . blend until smooth, or pulse a few times if you prefer a chunky sauce . remove the skillet from the oven and pour the chipotle tomato sauce on top . be careful of any splatters since the skillet will be very hot stir the sauce in the skillet and let it sit and cook with the residual heat for 2 minutes . garnish meatballs with chopped cilantro and serve.

name: tex mex breakfast casserole
description: this easy tex mex breakfast casserole has all the makings of a delicious breakfast potatoes, chorizo, green chilies and cheese . topped with salsa and avocado, this is perfect to feed a crowd
ingredients: 14.5 ounce can diced potatoes, 2 links cooked chorizo sausage, 2 cans, 2 cups shredded colby monterey jack cheese, 12 large eggs, 1/2 cup chopped scallions, 1/2 teaspoon seasoned salt such as adobo, 1 jalapeno, 4 ounces 1 small haas avocado, sliced, 1 cup chunky mild salsa
steps: spray a 3 qt 9" x 13" oblong glass pyrex baking dish with cooking spray . place the potatoes in the baking dish . top with chorizo, green chiles and 1 cup of the cheese . in medium bowl, beat eggs, scallions and seasoning salt with a whisk until well blended . pour over potato mixture . cover with lid and refrigerate overnight, if preparing the night before . when ready to bake, remove from the refrigerator and let it come to room temperature . pre heat the oven to 325degf . bake uncovered 55 to 60 minutes or until knife inserted near center comes out clean . remove from the oven, top with the remaining 1 cup of cheese and jalapeno slices . bake 2 more minutes, until the cheese melts . to serve, cut into 10 squares and serve with salsa and avocado.

name: wafeltjes met koffie royaal ijs
description: de koffie in combinatie met de wafeltjes en het ijs maken dat dit toetje heerlijk is . wafeltjes met koffie royaal ijs is klaar in 15 minuten . ijs maken is niet nodig . je kan natuurlijk altijd kiezen voor het zelf ijs maken.
ingredients: 250.0 gram aardbeien, 1.0 container hertog koffie royaal, 12.0 wafeltjes
steps: maak de aardbeien schoon en snijd de aardbeien in kwarten . haal het hertog koffie royaal ijs uit de vriezer . verdeel 4 wafeltjes over 4 borden . schep op ieder wafeltje een bol ijs . leg op die bol koffie ijs weer een wafel en daarop weer een bol ijs . sluit af met een wafeltje . leg de aardbei kwartjes er als garnering bij.

name: pizza crust
description: pizza crust with active dry yeast, warm water, white lily enriched unbleached bread flour, salt, sugar, extra virgin olive oil, crisco original no stick cooking spray
ingredients: 0.2 ounce active dry yeast, 1.2 cup warm water, 3.2 cup white lily enriched unbleached bread flour, 1.0 teaspoon salt, 1.0 tablespoon sugar, 1.0 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil, crisco original no stick cooking spray
steps: stir yeast into warm water in small bowl . combine flour, salt and sugar in large bowl . stir in yeast mixture until blended . add olive oil . stir 3 minutes or until a smooth dough forms . coat large bowl with no stick cooking spray . place dough in bowl, turning to coat surface . cover loosely with plastic wrap . let rise in warm place until doubled in size, about 1 hour . punch dough down . divide into two equal pieces . cover with towel . let rest 10 minutes . press into 2 12 inch pizza pans . cover and let rise in warm place about 20 minutes . heat oven to 425degf . top crusts with favorite pizza toppings and cheese . bake 25 to 30 minutes or until lightly browned.

name: petits financiers little almond cakes
description: a cookbook's journey from anne willan to tori avey . read about anne's memoir one souffle at a time and try her recipe for petits financiers.
ingredients: 1 cup butter, plus more for the molds, 2/3 cup whole blanched almonds, 3/4 cup flour, sifted, plus more for the molds, 2 1/4 cups cups powdered sugar, sifted, 7 large egg whites
steps: to brown the butter have a bowl of cold water ready . in a small saucepan melt the butter and heat until it stops sputtering, stirring often to prevent the milk solids from burning.when the milk solids at the bottom are lightly browned and the butter has developed a nutty smell and flavor, remove from the heat and plunge the base of the pan into the bowl of cold water to stop the cooking it will scorch very easily . let it cool to lukewarm . to grind the almonds, put them in a food processor with the flour . work with the pulse button until finely ground, 40 to 60 seconds . put the almond and flour mixture into a bowl, stir in the powdered sugar and make a well in the center . whisk the egg whites until slightly frothy and pour into the well . stir with a whisk until smooth . put the mixture into a heavy based medium saucepan, set it over low heat, and stir constantly until the mixture is just warm to the touch . take the pan from the heat and stir in the brown butter . be sure to mix very well so that the mixture is completely homogenous and smooth . cover and leave the batter to stand for 4 hours at room temperature so the flour softens and the financiers bake more evenly.when 4 hours have passed, preheat the oven to 425 degrees f and place a rack in the center of the oven . butter the financier mold generously with melted butter and chill until set . sprinkle the mold with flour and tap on the counter to remove the excess.place the mold on a sheet tray . pour the batter into a pitcher and fill the mold nearly to the top . be sure that the batter is spread evenly in the molds, otherwise your financiers will not bake evenly across the top.bake for 12 to 15 minutes, until the financiers are risen, golden brown, and firm when lightly pressed with a fingertip.unmold them onto a rack and leave to cool . bake the remaining batter in as many batches as necessary . your financiers can be kept up to a week in an airtight container, or frozen, and the flavor mellows.

name: passover french toast
description: kosher for passover french toast from kristy at eat, play, love with homemade passover citrus sponge cake made from matzo cake meal . kosher, dairy, pesach.
ingredients: 12 large eggs, separated, 1 1/2 cups sugar, 1/2 cup freshly squeezed orange juice, zest from 1 lemon, zest from 1 orange, 1/4 cup passover potato starch, 1 cup passover matzo cake meal, 1/2 tsp kosher salt, divided, 1/2 cup milk, 2 large eggs, zest from 1 lemon, zest from 1 orange, 8 slices passover citrus sponge cake, 2 tbsp butter, 2 tbsp cinnamon sugar
steps: preheat the oven to 325f . grease a 10 inch bunt cake or angel food cake pan . beat the 12 egg yolks in a mixing bowl until frothy . add the sugar and whisk until combined, then whisk in the lemon and orange zest along with the orange juice . in a small mixing bowl, sift together the potato starch and cake meal . add the dry ingredients to the egg yolks, stirring gently to combine . next, using an electric mixer on high speed, beat the egg whites from 12 eggs until they are stiff and shiny . use a rubber spatula to gently fold the egg whites into the batter, 1/3 of the mixture at a time, until incorporated . do not fold more than necessary . finally pour the batter into the cake pan and bake for an hour to an hour and 10 minutes, or until the cake has set and a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean . remove the cake from the oven and immediately invert it onto a plate . let it sit in the pan until completely cooled before removing the cake pan from the cake.

name: rolletjes van mozzarella en aubergine
description: de aubergine melanzane is een echte mediterrane groente . gegrild zijn ze op hun best, zoals in dit gerecht.
ingredients: 4.0 tomaten, 1.0 clove knoflook, 3.0 tablespoon bertolli originale extra vergine olijfolie, 1.0 bunch basilicum, 1.0 aubergine, 200.0 gram mozzarella, zout
